Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel twice now, in 2011 and 2012, and we love it. There is a very good fitness and wellness centre on the top floor, with a decent gym, spa, sauna and swimming pool. The breakfast is extensive and high quality. The staff have always been very welcoming and helpful. The rooms have stylish, modern decor and big, comfortable beds. The hotel is close to the tiergarten and you can walk to museum island (although it isn't a short walk). We didn't feel like going out for dinner one evening and ate in one of the hotel's restaurants. We don't usually like hotel restaurants, but the food was good quality and not at all overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Central great location but peaceful”
Reviews.Author: AnneF329
Reviews.Content: I have just returned after 4 nights at the Grand Hyatt. A fabulous minimal but warm/welcoming totally 5* hotel right in the centre of the city but slightly set back from the Potsdamer Platz so quiet. Access to both the S and U-Bahn transport system is a few minutes walk so getting around is easy. Great attention to detail both in design of the large very comfortable bedrooms (fabulous bathrooms) and also the service which was faultless. A free bottle of water and fruit (apples) were replaced daily. The rooftop pool has views across the city and the largest whirlpool jacuzzi ever. The spa is, again, up to the minute with great facilities. I love sushi and being able to order a delicious selection via room service from the Vox restaurant made it for me!

Reviews.Title: “Swimming pool with a view”
Reviews.Author: Mark_B12345
Reviews.Content: Sometimes its hard to pick a location when visiting Berlin. But if you stay (in Hyatt) near Postdamer platz in Mitte you can't go wrong. Nice contemporery hotel, with relaxed but attentive staff, trendy minimalistic interiors and great rooftop spa (gym and pool). Maybe rooms need some update. And free internet should be standard nowadays. Great hotel to relax after Berlin's wild nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Be in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: seattlenativemike
Reviews.Content: Really nothing to complain about. Central to where I needed to be for work and lots to do closeby. I walked everywhere from here including the Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Sony Center, Siegessäule Victory Column etc. Very friendly and gracious staff. Great breakfast and numerous eating options nearby. Very clean rooms with great bathrooms. Loved the walk in showers and heated floors. Just enough local flavor in the decor to remind you you werent in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: billyboy68
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an Easter break here. Got a very good flight hotel deal on myberlin.com which included breakfast for 3 nights. Check-in was a breeze, and loved the room on arrival. Stayed in room 511, which was quite roomy. Really liked the bathroom, with nice big bath and wet-room shower. It even had a LCD TV in it. Very nicely furnished, we had decent sleep on large comfortable beds, spotlessly clean, and can't fault it at all. Breakfast next morning was lovely... everything you could possibly want. Staff very friendly. There is a very nice business centre just left side of the main reception. It has free internet access, and you can also print stuff for free - handy if you want to print boarding passes or places you want to visit. The location for the hotel is perfect, there is a very nice shopping mall across the road, and Potsdamer Platz station is 100 meters away, so it has excellent transport links. I would highly recommend this hotel for a city break, we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect – highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: vibekeml
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this fabulous hotel in March. Everything was top notch – from the modern yet welcoming lobby, to the extremely fancy and extravagant rooms. Never seen anything like this before – specially the design of the bathroom/wardrobe made an impression! Had breakfast, drinks in the lobby and lunches – all high quality. The service level throughout the hotel was friendly, efficient and helpful – I was really impressed and will highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfer13i
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with one potential problem. First, the potential problem. During our stay, a group had a party with a band in the hotel ballroom. We were on the third floor, and the sound from the band was like they were in our room. This went on until about three in the morning. Management apologized the next day and comped our breakfasts and a few other things. I would strongly recommend checking this with the hotel before booking. This was only a problem on one night out of seven. Other than this, everything about the hotel was wonderful. The exercise facilities and pool were excellent. Breakfast were great. But the best thing about the hotel was the incredibly helpful staff from the concierge to the bellmen. We have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world, and the service here ranks with any of them. From Berlin we went to South Africa and had no use for our heavy winter clothes. The hotel arranged to have them shipped back to the US. They arrived safely yesterday. This is but one example of the great service.

Reviews.Title: “great facilities, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bobby3519
Reviews.Content: we stayed recently at the Hyatt Berlin, I never leave a review but I have to say that it is an excellent hotel, with great facilities. The rooms are spacious, the bathroom is spacious and a different layout than the usual, nice for a change!. The leisure facilities are excellent and very handy to get to just up on the 8th floor.The pool is not huge but big enough for a stretch, the hot tub is great, big and plenty of room. The suna/steam room is just what you need after a day of sightseeing. The hotel is in a great location , just circa 400m away from Potsdamer Platz, with its U & S Bahn stations, so easy access to all of Berlin. Also all the sightseeing buses stop on Potzdamer Platz as well. This area was redeveloped in the1990's, so there are lots of restaurants, and cinemas and a theatre right next door to the hotel..which brings a great buzz to the area, also the sony centre is just a block away, and the Arcadian shopping centre just across the road. The service is excellent, and friendly and most accommodating. All in all a most enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Short but good!”
Reviews.Author: orish1
Reviews.Content: Couple of days I stayed for 1 night in Grand Hyatt Berlin. I know some Hyatts around the world, but the Berlin Hyatt had an extraordinary and friendly service...wether it was at the reception or the stuff doing the bar, the luggage or the car. Everything in the room was clean, comfortable, nice and a not to overdressed style. Just some notices what I liked...we had a smoking room. During a 3 hours walk through Berlin the stuff cleaned the ashtray in the room. I gave my car keys to the door man and went to the reception to pay my bill. On the way to the garage he saw me waiting with my luggage and came back to ask if he could take my luggage. Thoughtful service.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flemming H
Reviews.Content: The level of cleanliness in this hotel is first class

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meixjul
Reviews.Content: am staying here for 4 nights at Grand Hyatt Berlin. The room is modern, large and well furnished/equipped. The breakfast choice and food quality is the best compared to other luxury hotels. The reception, housekeeping and breakfast staff are very friendly and helpful. Just few minor comments, Free WIFI Internet in rooms would have been appreciated in this era and age and ofcourse given the price and the level of the hotel,they can manage giving this free

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: revilo77Dubai
Reviews.Content: This is now the 4th time I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt since 2008 and my second Trip Advisor review. I always stay at this hotel during ITB as my company has a group block there. The service of this hotel is exceptional and it always feels good to be back. Check-in is very fast and sufficient and luggage was promptly delivered to my room. The bell boy was kind enough to take care of my shoes and shirt to have them cleaned and ironed the same day. I always stay in a Grand Deluxe King room which has all the amenities a business traveler is looking for. The bed is very comfortable and the desk has sufficient power outlets with international sockets which make adapters redundant. The room features a nice B&O TV set and also has a small TV in the bathroom - it's really great to watch the news in the morning while getting dressed. The staff in the breakfast room a very warm and friendly and any order is fullfilled immediately. I had drinks with a friend at the bar one evening and the service was very professional and friendly. A also ordered room service (Wiener Schnitzel) one day and the food quality was very high and the service fast and friendly. Even after several years of staying here the hotel hasn't lost its touch. It's a great business hotel which I can recommend to any traveller looking for a bit of luxury and indulgence. I will most likely be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Dogontour
Reviews.Content: Booked over the internet for an 'emergency' business trip and after trawling the usual sites found a very agreeable rate. The hotel has a certain Germanic style which I happen to like, and is constructed in 'Grand' dimensions. The check in staff and concierge were incredibly friendly and helpful, in fact all the staff were. The room was enormous, fantastically clean and comfortable and there is an incredibly good spa on the roof. Get a 'discount' rate and its unbeatable value too! I will definitely return and thoroughly enjoyed my short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference venue”
Reviews.Author: GolfladyUk
Reviews.Content: Just back from running a conference and gala dinner at this hotel. Excellent conference facilities - main exhibition area and good selection of boardrooms all located on the same floor (which can be difficult to find on occasions). Very receptive and helpful staff throughout day event and the service at the event dinner was excellent. This level of service also reflected throughout the rest of the hotel. Ideal location - a number of sights within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “High level, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: fanharuka
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt is a so famous name that it seems impossible to say something negative, but I have to: for the first time in my ltraveller ife I had an already occupied room! Mistakes can happen, but in my opinion not if you pay 500,00 euro per night. Besides that wrong start, hospitality was ok, but for usre for such money I would have more. Crazy prices also to their Bar and at their lounge. Other thing surprised me was breakfast: good quality, but no so wide variety and no special food for who need to follow special diets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: haakonks
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in February. Had booked a standard room with a king bed, and was upgraded to a Club Deluxe room. The staff in the reception was very friendly and helpful, and we were helped up to our room, and was also showed the features of the room. The room had very nice furnitures, and it was quiet and both the room and the bathroom was clean. The service from the staff at the Club Lounge was also excellent, always friendly and service minded. They also helped us find restaurants and book tables. The service from house keeping was very good, all amenities and towels was replaced and the supply of bottled water was also replaced. The hotel is located centrally at Potsdam Platz, and it is very easy to geting around to the sights in Berlin. I have stayed at this hotel before, and I will also come back next time I am in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “chatan@themistryman.co.uk”
Reviews.Author: chatanm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night this week for work and thought it was excellent. The receptionist was incredibly happy and helpful, and this impression of their staff stayed throughout my stay. The hotel room itself was also very good - the room was a standard size with a queen bed, but the bathroom was very different - large with a heated floor and a glass pane between the bath/walk-in-shower and the main basin. Very contemporary - I really like it. The room was also very quiet. I was there on the first day of the Berlin Film Festival (which I didn't realise when I booked!) but I didn't get any noise from outside, either the windows or the corridor. I didn't try the restaurant or the room service, but the breakfast was good. All in a all a great place to stay, and a good location for getting to the Berlin sights. Definitely will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay during Berlinale”
Reviews.Author: Metcalf1
Reviews.Content: Super hotel. Lovely rooms and great swimming pool on top floor with panoramic views. Excellent service and food. My ONLY disappointment was having to pay for the wireless internet after the free half an hour (which is only available once every 24 hrs). In a hotel where one is paying more than £1000 for three nights (in the Grand Club), the hotel might be able to include free wireless. Sure, there is a business centre with computers one can use for free, but this is far away from the comfort of being able to connect using one's own laptop from one's room. Even the Holiday Inn Express has free wifi! Please do try to review your policy on this. It just seems terribly tacky to charge for WIFI in a hotel of this class.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuggapahJK
Reviews.Content: I checked in to this hotel after my flight back home had been cancelled and I was little apprehensive about it as I had previously been staying at the Ritz Carlton in Berlin and was toying with staying at the Ardlon; however, I was thoroughly pleased to have made the decision to stay at the Hyatt because it really is an excellent hotel. It has a relaxed, serene atmosphere and the service is personal, welcoming and they really make you feel valued (which is not a feature I can say I experienced at the Ritz or when visiting the Ardlon for drinks). The room is well equipped and comfortable; the shower is high pressured and invigorating and the spa is extremely relaxing. The club lounge is a indulgent bonus but really adds to the exclusivity of the stay. Overall I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: martinnyc1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt, Berlin sixteen times. The most recent stay was December 27, 2011 to January 1, 2012. It's a great hotel. The service is fantastic and the facilities are first rate. I'm headed back again in June and I'm really looking forward to it. It's the best hotel I've ever stayed in and never disappoints me.

Reviews.Title: “Well located for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: MaryZ60
Reviews.Content: This is a very well presented hotel - attractive interior, interesting artwork. We had a very nice king room with a view; the room was spacious, quiet and very clean with a very comfortable bed. A window that opened was a welcome feature. The bathroom was large, with a bath and a walk in shower. An ironing board is not standard in the room but was brought immediately we asked for one. The staff were, on the whole, very friendly and we received a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine when a member of staff spotted a birthday when we exchanged travelers' cheques.The hotel is very well located for sightseeing but less so if you are looking for a lively night life. The hotel seems to cater more to business guests than tourists and we felt very under-dressed among the shirts and ties and suits at Saturday morning breakfast, and I didn't feel that the staff were comfortable with our attire. Our cons are minor in relation to the positives: very limited English language TV channels - basically only sport and news. Films were on offer but quite old and at 10 euros expensive. Wifi was also expensive at 18 euros a day (the first half hour was free). Given the price of the rooms I think you could reasonably expect free wifi. Better water pressure in the shower would be nice. The breakfast buffet was disappointing - especially the hot food which tended to be over-cooked and greasy. All that said, overall we loved the look of the hotel and the room, and had a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: patrick31Uk
Reviews.Content: This a 5* hotel which really is...along with some of the prices! Room excellent and very quiet ( courtyard facing and party walls appear to have effective sound proofing which is often not the case even in good quality hotels). The bathroom area is large and very well appointed. Ice delivered each night but use sparingly with the contents of the mini bar- very expensive (as usual). Location great. Food also very good but we limited to one night only due to the cost of the wine (38e- cheapest!) but not a problem as surrounded by very good restuarants and bars. The jewel of the hotel is the 9th floor spa area- swam on Christmas day overlooking Berlin followed by steam room and luxury shower/spa facilities! This hotel delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: KirKanos
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to redeem a three night stay at this property courtesy of the Gold Passport program. I arrived in Berlin around 1pm at the hotel from Tegel airport and was promptly checked into my choice of a King sized bed room. The hotel looked really modern and a bit minimalist - the rooms when I entered were spacious and had every luxury inside, including heated floors in the bathroom (which were much appreciated during winter!) - in terms of room amenities we had a B&O flat screen TV (not that we would spend much time in the room!). The beds were large and very nice to sleep on. The room I was in was situated a distance from the main lift however, it was much closer to the Club Olympus lifts - which led to the health club. I wandered up to the health club and saw there was a nice gym, changing rooms which led to a German sauna / steam room (mixed genders) at the back and a heated swimming pool and jacuzzi. I did spend a couple of mornings just soaking in the jacuzzi which was wonderful in winter! The location of this property was wonderful as it was within 10-15 minutes of the Brandenburg gate (I stayed during the New Year's Eve so it was a bonus just walking to and from the gate!) - the sound of fireworks going off late into the night didn't really bother me much. The U and S Bahns and trams and bus stations were also very close by within a 5-10 minute walk. Food - I can't really comment on since I did not eat at all in the hotel - however they had some nice touches like leaving some sweets / chocolates in a bowl in the bedroom. Internet - I guess this was the only thing I would pick on as you were only allowed 30 mins per device per 24 hours and would then have to pay for the rest of the usage. Price - I can't really comment since this was a redemption! Concierge was very helpful in pointing us to the places we wanted to go to on the map.

Reviews.Title: “State of the art luxury accomodations”
Reviews.Author: eolmosc
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, modern luxury, fríendly staff, confortable rooms, large bathrooms, good restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel, good location 5 minutes walk from Potsdammerplatz”
Reviews.Author: francoda
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with some quirky architecture, excellent location 5 minutes walk from Potsdammerplatz, Sony Centre and adjacent to theatres, bars and restaurants. Taxi rank outside and U Bahn, S Bahn and mainline station only 5 minutes walk away. Rooms have big screen TV with pay movies, pay WIFI (fee moderate), good size bathroom with separate shower and bath, mini bar, comfortable bed. I was in an executive room with lounge access. Lounge includes complimentary soft and alcoholic drinks, snacks, continental breakfast, food nice but I have had more substantial in similar hotel lounges. Three restauraunts on site plus 24 hour room service. Food good, price moderate to high. I am a breakfast fan but as per most hotels in continental europe cooked breakfast is not the best. Pool tiny but substantial spa with the usual pricey treatments. My only negative is I was facing the (pedestrian) street in front of the hotel, there was a lot of noise and music at about 1am from the theartres and casino. This 5 star hotel is on a par with best hotels in Berlin (Adlon, Ritz Carlton etc), price moderate to high but deals available, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveller888
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the berlinale in feb. It's a first class hotel, friendly staff ,nice and clean rooms . Few steps away from a mall. Further down is the Sony center and subway. Restaurants are everywhere . A starbucks across the street. Dunkin donuts with wifi ( you have to pay for it) at the back of hotel . Not much excitement at night except for the casino nearby. There are two train stations . Each go a different route. Ask the concierge where you are going and what underground station to take. Don't forget to get tax rebate every time you buy something

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the Club Lounge”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: This was the seventh time we had stayed at the Hyatt, and we checked into room 505, a deluxe room, unfortunately overlooking the atrium: it was a lovely room, large with big comfy bed, separate sitting area, desk, fridge style minibar, plenty of storage space, kettle. The bathroom was quite big with two basins, bath and separate shower and wc. The Grand Club Lounge was closed for refurbishment, which we were told in an e-mail just a week before we arrived, so we went down to Tizian Lounge where we were told a replacement service would be provided. We were given a small menu with four starters, four mains and four desserts, from which we ordered and they all arrived together. The bar was busy and we had to keep asking for service. We subsequently complained to the management as the experience was nothing like as good as the Grand Club Lounge has been on other stays here, and we wondered why they hadn't turned a function room into a temporary lounge. They didn't have an answer to that, although a Duty Manager subsequently made contact to discuss our concerns, and they gave us a small gift on leaving. The other problem was that we were there for three nights and the menu was the same every night, which got a bit boring. Apart from the problem with the lounge, we enjoyed our stay, but having paid a lot of money to stay in a Club Room, the temporary service provided was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Grand Hyatt Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Joyjoyo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 days and 3 nights at the Grand Hyatt Berlin over Christmas weekend. I would definitely recommend the hotel. Perfect service, spacious room, very spacious and relaxing bathroom. My problem was I barely wanted to leave the hotel to go see the city! My husband also used the gym and said the facilities were very nice with a running track and beautiful pool as well. We had a great breakfast a la carte at the Vox restaurant where the service was impeccable. The front desk staff is very helpful and eager to share advice on Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “First Class, Personable”
Reviews.Author: docGamba
Reviews.Content: This is a true 5 star hotel, no ands, ifs or buts. The rooms are not only beautiful but they are well designed and laid out right. Bathrooms are large with heated floors, closets within the confines of the bathroom. Make up mirror that adjusts to a person's height. And a staff that is dedicated to its craft - they are they to help. Example: we bought a nice bottle of white wine at the KaDeWe and needed a cork screw to open it and to enjoy in our room. The woman on duty for room service that evening not only opened the wine, she got a special bucket and put salt in it so the wine would quickly chill. Great service without any pretension. And the location Pottsdamer Platz is excellent. I've stayed at two other 5 stars hotels in Berlin and I would put this property at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “A very elegant hotel, but could be better in terms of customer service!”
Reviews.Author: KazimKirmani
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt Berlin is a very elegant and lavish hotel and I had the pleasure to stay there for 5 nights. Since the weather in Berlin was not upto my suiting (for me winter is 15-20c.. and it was -5c at that time!), hence I was mostly stuck inside the hotel or at best within walking distance, as I had to repeatedly to return to warm myself up! While I had originally booked for a Grand King Single room, I was upgraded to a Grand King Double room at no extra cost, and that came in handy for a someone who likes to move sideways free while deep in sleep! Breakfast at Vox is healthy and hearty: the spread is the best that can be! One is simply spoiled for choice, and if you like a good, heavy breakfast (like I do!) than I would recommend a good 1 hour be set aside for this ritual. The hotel is incredibly modern, well-maintained and while modern with original artwork adorning the common areas and the rooms, it isn't all too over-bearing and it all sinks in perfectly well. I didn't try out any of the restaurants there, so I won't be able to comment much about this area. The Sony Centre next door was amazing, and everything else was also within walking distance: I did trips to the Berlin Wall museums as well as the Holocaust memorial and the Checkpoint Charlie all on foot. The reception could have been better manned, and while I did ask repeatedly for help on my walks - the guy at the concierge appeared really friendly - but his directions weren't too helpful. Also, what he directed to me was of not much interest to me. I was indeed offered a map too, but again, since I was new to the city and had shorter time at hand due to the business nature of my trip, I always found that I could have done better with some extra help from the concierge! I guess I paid about 150 euros per night, but it was worth the stay. Only thing I would say is that it could do better in terms of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary design, spacious rooms and fantastic indoor pool”
Reviews.Author: ebennike
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a large part of the family - a party of 10 people. My son, wife and I stayed in a grand suite, which was fantastic. Two separate rooms and lots of space. Everything seemed pretty new and well kept, and the best of it all was that all drinks and snacks from the minibar, the club lounge and the wine and booze in the room was complimentary. That was really nice. What I particularly liked about this hotel was the spa on the top floor. We did not have any treatments up there, but we used the pool, the steam room and the sauna a few times, and especially the jacuzzi next to the pool was so nice to sit in and relax after a cold day in the city. Location is ok - we normally stay in hotels around Ku'damm, but Postdamer Platz has turned into a rather nice corner of the city, and the walk to Friedrichstrasse is quite short, so we were just fine with this location. We had a few issues with the hotel - first, when we arrived 1½ hours after official check-in time, two of the five rooms were not ready yet. That is not ok at this level. We were compensated with a drink that turned out to take 30 mins to arrive. Not really getting any more pleased by this. One of the rooms had issues with noise from a seemingly karaoke bar one floor beneath. Both issues were compensated more than fairly on our check out bill without having to create a big scene about it, which we found was extremely good customer service. So even though we had a few issues, both were resolved caringly from the hotel's side, and we left very happy with our choice. I would recommend this hotel to anybody - also families with children even though there are not many of them at this hotel. We will surely return at another occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Realy five star superior hotel”
Reviews.Author: aleksandarBeograd
Reviews.Content: Downtown location(Berlin Mitte)Modern spacios lobby.Staff friendly. The beautifule large ,grand king 38 sq metre room,comfortable beds with bang&olufsen flat-tv great stylish bathroom.Very nice club olimpus fitness centre,spa,rooftop swiming pool. Highly recommend this five star hyatt hotel

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Wherever the cheap fares take me
Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: antonius66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights on a recent trip to Germany for christmas markets. We paid 153 euro a night for a standard room. The hotel is about 5 minutes and 7-10 euro by taxi from the train station, which is very nice. The lobby is nice, although it has a very odd large blue square on the wood panelling when you enter, which may be artistic but I though just did not work. Check in was simple and easy enough, and the lady was very friendly. We were given a map at check in and the clerk was very friendly and made sure we knew where things were and to let her know if we had any other questions. The rooms were satisfactory. They were a decent enough size. There were not really any views to speak of. The bathroom was large enough for 2 of us to move around it, although it was a little hard to find the light switches in the night, and some of the lights they turn on are a weird choice, as some of them can awaken the other person. The shower was large and spacious, and had a rain shower with seperate tub, much like the Hyatt Regency Cologne. The TV was a flat screen with the standard assortment of international channels. We had breakfast in the club lounge every day, which was good. It was about on par with the Hyatt in Cologne and Mainz, although I would give the GH Berlin the edge. There were a few more choices in the cold meat department, and they had very very good fresh made apple juice. Also, they offered more hot egg choices for those who care, other than just hard boiled. There was a standard assortment of yogurt, breads, etc like always. The breads were very good, as they were at each hotel. In the evenings there were desserts and some light hot foods, which were nice. A little step above the other Hyatt Regency Clubs, as you could definitely eat dinner in the club if you wanted/had to. There was a little room with a computer in the club for email/internet, and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel is well located, as it is very close the train station and is only about a 10-15 minute walk from the Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag. You can easily walk to those sights, and you are already in the Potsdamer Platz where there are restaurants and shopping, etc. A taxi to Tegel (TXL) airport early in the morning cost us about 18 euro and took about 10-15 minutes. Only had 1 minor issue and that was a 2.5 euro charge on my bill at checkout for "parking" which was odd since we did not have any vehicles. They took it off without any argument and it was gone from the copy of my bill I received, although I strangely had a seperate charge for about $3.40 US when I returned home, but this was promptly removed by my credit card company. Not sure if it was that, but I can't imagine it was anything else. A very minor issue though, which was fixed easily. Overall a great stay and a great hotel, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Betsy2003
Reviews.Content: The service really makes this hotel stand out. There was never any request too large for the staff to complete. This hotel caters to the "suit and briefcase" crowd. The hotel is located in the Potsdamer Platz district so it doesn't have a lot of wild night life. It's more of a sedate atmosphere. You can catch the train (Potsdamer Platz U-Bahn station is blocks away) and be in a more vibrant party scene. I stayed on the 7th floor and had the continental breakfast each morning in the Grand Club. The food was great, the service even better. Jane F. is one of the employees that works in the Grand Club, she provided excellent service and always remembered my name. Not an easy task with a full hotel. There are many restaurants (and yes even a Starbucks) surrounding the area in which you can find almost anything to eat. Or you can go to the Arcade (shopping mall) and find a large variety of open food bars. Rooms are quite and comfortable and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 13_Eleni
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay concerning every little detail!!! Very efficient staff at the reception, beutiful design of the corridors, the rooms, everywhere... Great beds, make you feel you want to sleep forever.... The location is just the best, in Potzdamer Platz, near the Sony center, where you can reach the main sites of Berlin on foot or take the bus or the tube from just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Wunderbar hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel...from the friendly check in though to the best spa facility in a major city I have yet to experience.. Let me recount for you how great this hotel is... 1. Rooms - very comfortable, soundproofed and luxurious fixtures and fittings. The bath/shower 'sliding door' room was great...and the towels, Aveda toiletries and great lighting and mirrors. Just what a perfect bathroom should be. 2. the sleep - bed was super comfy, lots of pillows, blackout curtain and easy to operate lighting from bed...and an amazing TV too.. easy to sleep...zzzzz! 3. Spa - fantastic. I had the best massage of my life here... Steve the masseur is a sports physio and does deep tissue/shiatsu-esque... absolutely fantastic. The spa is mixed sexes and very German (e.g. everyone is nude...and wearing a bathing suit in the sauna is verboten...or, at least frowned upon. Sorry - but I am uncomfortable sitting naked with the equivalent of my parents and a few complete strangers in searing heat inches apart and thinking it is 'natural' and not unusual!) ok...back to the spa.. clean, modern, great showers and facilities...but the pool! And jacuzzi...with a great view and relaxing vibe.. post massage it was truly relaxing...along with the free Aveda tea.. Staff were super polite and courteous. Spoke perfect english and couldnt have been more helpful. The gym was small - but good equipment, but crowded between 6pm and 8pm on weekdays. 4. location, location, location - right on U/S Bahn... good shoppping next door at the Arkade and easy to walk to best sights and Tiergarten. Truly in the centre of the city and not too touristy...but lots of touristy things to do, and good restaurants at all prices. 5. MESA - a great concept... German tapas. Excellent...the beet salad and dark bread were delicious, but the goulash was fantastic! great wine choices and perfect service. Save room for the streussel! 6. Front desk staff - helpful, courteous, efficient and always seemed to be available and free...and if there was a queue, they acknowledged all guests and offered an apology promising to be 'right with you'... kudos to the management, I have NEVER had that happen before. An apology to people waiting to check in or check out... you get the feeling that this hotel is run by a top pro - and it shows! 7. the artwork in the hotel - beautiful, with a nice book explaining all about the pieces...and in the room, the nice touches of vases and books was great...I never felt it was a hotel, more like a private apartment in the middle of Berlin! my only gripes... housekeeping took all day to clean our room every day we were there... usually around 4pm...however, they did a very good job and literally wiped every surface and used the vaccum as if the carpet was fithy.. german tidiness gone mad! And gripe number two - why not free wifi in the rooms? The 3 euros per hour offered by Swiss com is highway robbery..though the first 30 mins are free... but apart from those two minor gripes... the Grand Hyatt is one of the best hotels in the world, and definately in Berlin! Many thanks... will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fab!”
Reviews.Author: Jensky100
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to win a weekend stay at this hotel. The location of the Grand Hyatt Berlin is perfect as you can explore Berlin very easily from here. It is nestled amongst shops, restaurants and entertainment. The hotel itself was fabulous, from the service to the amenities. We only ate breakfast there, and that was tip top. The rooftop spa was excellent also. I was so impressed with the swimming pool, the sauna and steam rooms and the high stainless steel plunge pool had the wow factor. I dare you if you're brave enough - it was freezing! The bedroom was clean and comfortable and the shower/bathroom was lovely. I love the fact that this hotel was contemporary and laid back without compromising on service, style and quality. All in all we had a wonderful stay there and it was my lucky day winning that prize!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: eTurboNews
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Berlin is next to the Casino in Berlin, and in immediate walking distance to the Potsdam Square, many shops, restaurants, entertainment. You will be able to explore all of Berlin. The subway and many bus lines depart in immediate walking distance from the hotel. The Grand Hyatt Berlin is a modern property. Rooms are relatively small, but have all the expected amenities. If you travel alone don't take a twin room. The beds are very small, and almost uncomfortable. I love the pool and gym facilities on the top floor. You need to check out the restaurants in the hotel. I had access to the Hyatt Club with complimentary breakfast. You should at least one time pay for the breakfast downstairs - it's worth it. I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Berlin several times, The staff made me feel welcome. It appears rates at some times are very reasonable, at other times out of line expensive.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wpbkc
Reviews.Content: This is a tremendous hotel in a perfect location. Service on the Concierge Level was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best Hyatt I've stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: 5StarVagabond
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best Hyatt I've stayed at, and that includes the Park Hyatt Chicago - Park Hyatt Istanbul, Park Hyatt Dubai... and the list goes on. There is an amazing attention to detail, the staff and management genuinely care and unlike most hotel restaurants, they have among the best hotel restaurants I've eaten at. I practically live in hotels and it pained me to leave this one. The art in the hotel is also exceptional and intriguing.

Reviews.Title: “Phone bill was more than the air ticket!”
Reviews.Author: Nigel73Oslo
Reviews.Content: In today's world of Skype and IP telephony - I can't believe that a hotel like this is still stinging their guests with crazy phone rates. My 30 minute call within Europe was priced at 125€ !!!! That's more than my return flight ticket from Scandinavia The hotel made a discount after some heavy discussion. I won't be coming back to this hotel next time I'm in Berlin. I was however, having a great stay until I went to check out - but at the end of the day, it's the hotel who have left this bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: mattperk
Reviews.Content: The location of the Grand Hyatt could not have been better. In addition, the room, pool, and staff were first class.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Wald4
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with many amenities. Nice gym and roof top indoor pool with great view. This is a very big hotel so if you like smaller boutique style hotels this is not for you. I found the location to be in a nice area with shops and restaurants. The biggest negative for me was the conceirge. He acted like we were annoying him every time we asked a simple question. Overrall, a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: EFDV
Reviews.Content: This is a first quality hotel. The rooftop pool and sauna are so relaxing after a day of sightseeing. The room is beautiful and the staff are very helpful. I would not even bother to look at another hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MKBSB
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife and its a really surprising hotel. The breakfast was the best I ever had since my honeymoon vacation in Bora Bora.

Reviews.Title: “first class service, courtesy and style”
Reviews.Author: cowieAberdeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in this wonderful modern hotel which can genuinely claim five star status. When we arrived, our room was not quite ready and we were immediately upgraded to a superior room than we had paid for, with complimentary breakfasts etc.The pool has views over the city and the situation of the hotel, generally, could not have been more convenient for sight-seeing and shopping.But it is the professional and friendly staff that make this hotel superb.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: notthatdeadyet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in town for the marathon. Excellent location, wonderful staff, great gym/spa. Only drawback is that the beds are very German (ie, firm!). Kinda hurt after the run. Would definitely recommend this hotel to all visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: In206
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel with 2 great restaurants (Vox and Mesa). Across the street from the Arkaden Shopping Mall which was very convenient for shopping and to grab a snack. The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The Spa was a great amenity. Steam room, gym, sauna, and cold plunge were great to use after a long day. An excellent experience in a great city !!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aua2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best hotel we have stayed in. The location is key, clearly in the nicest part of Berlin. There is a rooftop pool and infinity jacuzzi which are extremely nice. You get what you pay for here, as the rooms are perfect even with additional bells and whistles. The restaurants are a little pricy, but close enough to many great restaurants. The staff was extremely helpful finding restaurants as well as providing wine glasses while we were at the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel, we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: mbgandco
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is in a good position just off of the Potsdamer Platz by the Sony Centre and within easy walking distance of the Bradenberg Gate and other attractions. The views of the casino next door or the shopping mall by the back door may not be as iconic as you would wish but the Hotel offers other attractions. I had a very large room with a large comfortable bed. The bathroom has two sinks, a separate wet room and separate toilet with very nice Aveda accessories. The cable internet in the room was fast and gave 30 minutes for free (€18 for the day is however expensive). The hotel also features a leisure club with swimming pool and a couple of restaurants one of which, VOX, has a good jazz/soul band in the evenings and a lively bar. So why not a 5 star rating. Well firstly there are much better hotels in Berlin (the Adlon and Ritz Carlton to name just 2). Secondly, service can be sloppy (the room was not made up until after 5pm for example and check in out was very slow). All in all a good choice but not the best there is in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eric060
Reviews.Content: I spent 3days in Berlin on a business trip, staying on the club-floor. Compared to many Hyatts the food at breakfast and drink-time was not plentiful. The room and bathroom were both very nice. I thought the bed was comfortable and slept well. It was a bit tricky to understand how to fill the bath-tub and to regulate the shower. Once You knew - it was perfectly logic, though a bit different from what I was used to. I thought it was unpractical not to have a connection to the internet cable (wireless did not always work) from the desk but from behind the desk. I would also have preferred a bigger writing desk. I was upgraded to have free use of the minibar. Great, but they never refilled it and when my favorite beer was consumed I had to take the next best etc. The restaurant VOX was really great, very good quality of dinner. The area was a bit strange - felt sort of new and artificial although there were many restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to normal standard this time...”
Reviews.Author: Viking71
Reviews.Content: Writing this review from my room. I arrived at the hotel and the doormen were not very welcoming. The check in was very smooth. I really reccommend this hotel, even if it was a bit below pari this time. That said, Hyatt hotels in Europe hold a very high standard. But at this level, the service should be similar. I got a room and i think it smelled from cigarettes, I notified the reception very quiet and informed it could be some smell from cigarettes in my room, I also pointed out that maybe I was wrong. They said they would send housekeeping up, but I do not know if they have been here. Honestly, I think I sence the smell. But whatever, I could be wrong. What else can I say, the hotel is really fantastic and I would recommend it even if it hasnt suprised me very positive this time. Oh, almost forgot, I lifted the phone to order something and the whole phone was rather dirty. That is not so nice given that the bacterias are numerous on a phone. It should be cleaned. They probalbly also changed the light bulbs in the room, I'm sure they are eco firendly but absolutely not very elegant. Its a very strong neon light, like in a supermarket. It is actually possible to buy bulbs with a bit warmer tone, and still with a low energy usage. Just a friendly advice to the hotel that i really like. Roomservice was very good! All, in all; guess I just was a bit unlucky this time and still recommend the hotel of all my hart.

Reviews.Title: “grand it is!”
Reviews.Author: annes64
Reviews.Content: Luxurious, comfortable room, clean and spacious. Quiet too. Friendly staff, lovely lunches and breakfasts. Great location near potzdammer platz. Slept very good. Only the temperature of the shower could be improved. It went from cold to hot to cold a couple of times in the first 3 minutes or so. Shower gel would be nice too. But overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cool”
Reviews.Author: Tjottit
Reviews.Content: Big hotel machine with a modern design and interior. Very efficient and attentative service throughout. Spacious rooms with high tech tv, ipod dock etc. Several restaurants - we tried the main one af the ground floor and i'd rate it 7 out of 10. Pool, wellness, gym - all modern and clean and located on top floor so view is nice. Tourism in Berlin is quite exciting. Going out scene is rather underground/alternative. The pretty people are in Munich

Reviews.Title: “Not for families, but for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: efi_de
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to public transportation and the Sony Center, as well as some theatres and cinemas, restaurants and a shopping mall. Room was comfy, very well equipped, facing the patio over the greened roof of the administration. Non-smoking floors. I didn't visit the restaurants, only peeked in. Looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: helsinki_finland2008
Reviews.Content: + Great design + Fast service + Rooms are modern and clean - Not a central location, you have to take taxi/metro/walk to every where

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: uluvbs
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes based on the reviews here, but would not recommend it. Positives -1- Beautiful bathrooms -2- Blackout curtains for windows Negatives -1- The mattresses were horrible. You can immediately notice how flimsy and cheap they feel, and I really was surprised by this given the brand/reputation of the chain. We had just come from staying at another hotel in Europe (i.e., not at home) and the difference was night and day. It's difficult to enjoy yourself on vacation with a poor night's sleep. -2- While showering, virtually every minute the water would suddenly get several degrees hotter, and then immediately several degrees colder, and then return to your set temperature (like you would find in an old building -- not in an ultramodern hotel). This happened all three nights we were there, and all throughout the shower. It made for a rather unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “State of the art room”
Reviews.Author: Fayfife
Reviews.Content: Room was very high spec, particularly bathroom area - even had remote control blackout blind! Robe, slippers etc - deserves five stars. However I found attitude of concierge staff less than helpful when I asked why there was no milk in the room for tea making and was told this needed to be ordered through room service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: AussieGuys
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt Berlin is a great modern hotel, well located and with very caring young team of professionals on the front desk. The spa/sauna/pool area was immaculately clean each time we visited them. Plenty of places to eat within a short walk and easy access to transport and the majority of Berlin attractions. The shower set up is fantastic.....we didnt want to get out!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, Best I Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: antouvirgo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year while on a business trip and I was quite impressed with the service and the quality of the rooms. Though I stayed in a suite, I loved the view of berlin, the food was great, the hospitality was great. These people know how to make people at home. I will certainly be returning. Danke

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Grand is Grand in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: DavePics
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, spotless, excellent staff, pool and leisure facilities top draw, bedrooms you only dream about, location probably one of the best in Berlin. Only very minor, minor niggle, wifi is not free. Go to Blue Man theatre next door, the Austrailian Bar across road (great beer and atmosphere), Berlin is a top place to be at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Nice Hotel, but Sterile...”
Reviews.Author: radioactivenomad
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby feature with the skylight... overall too minimalist for my liking (i like minimal, but this was too stark) I liked the B&O TV in the bedroom, though I have definitely slept in more comfortable beds... Coffee shop was nice and the wait staff were quite friendly and helpful. All in all, pleasant if unmemorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “It´s a Hyatt, but needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: MariaElen
Reviews.Content: Good location,very good service, the common areas and the rooms need urgent maintenance, personally I really don't like dirty carpets!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wild about it!”
Reviews.Author: LevRaphael
Reviews.Content: I had a glorious few days here feeling very pampered and between two worlds. It's been marvelously updated but there is also a strong sense of the old Berlin even in the rooms which mix both worlds with skill and finesse. Food was superb and staff exceptional. One clerk went out of his way to help me on a very frustrating search and when I had dragged myself back to the hotel and wearily stepped to the elevators, he ran out from the desk after me to check if I was okay and if I had accomplished my mission. Das war klasse!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: jsthouston
Reviews.Content: If you have stayed at the Hyatt in Mainz or Hamburg you be familiar with the room and bathroom layout. I liked the automatic blinds in this hotel which I don't recall having in either of the others mentioned. The strong points of this hotel are the service and the fact that it has a couple of good restaurants - both the main dinning room and the tapas place with outside dinning. If you like scotch the bar has 300 or so varieties and is no more or less expensive that any of the nearby bars. I was not at all taken with Potsdamer Place which is reminded me of universal city in LA, a lot of chain restaurants and modern buildings without much character. I also do not like the fact that in the hall of your room they place a rather bright nightlight that you can only turn off by unplugging it from the wall. The latter is a minor issue and others seem to like the location but I did not. If you like Hyatts this is a fine one but it is not much different from those I have stayed in in South America and I think the room and bathroom layouts and size are identical to the others I have stayed at in Germany. I also found that the air conditioner was a bit under powered which is not unusual from my experence in Germany but certainly not the rule in five star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Trust the good reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Lilies51
Reviews.Content: We booked Grand Hyatt based mainly on TripAdvisor´s reviews and were very happy about our decision. Location is great, as some other reviewers pointed out. There are very good restaurants at walking distance - not to mention the 3 very good ones in the hotel itself, which we tried at dinner and recommend. We didn´t have breakfast though - it was not included in the rate and we found it a bit pricey, for we usually eat very little at morning. Very confortable room, very spacious shower, enough shelves in the bathroom for toiletries. A bit small wardrobe, but we managed to find a place for everything. We don´t usually go to the swimming pool when travelling abroad, but this time we enjoyed very much the delicious jacuzzi, so relaxing after a long day of sightseeing. Internet is free for half an hour, which was OK for tourists like us, but not so for business travellers. The hotel should change this policy, for internet nowadays is as necessary as water or electricity! Minor problems with housekeeping, but in general extremely nice and helpful staff - in special Mr. Aykut Kanbak, the tireless and always kind concierge, who helped us to make our stay in Berlin just perfect. We certainly will be back in our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Not much to complain here”
Reviews.Author: bluJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 3 nights. We had a king room, it was very clean, the bathroom was really modern with a separate room for the toilet. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Loved the man at the front door, name began with an M, I believe he was Russian. He was very helpful with bus/directions info. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, it was not included but went to the mall very close to get pastries. My only minus is that the hotel is not very close to all that Berlin has to offer. You really need to take some form of transportation to get to the major sights. We cut through the park to get to the Brandenburg Gate and walked to the Museum Island, a looooong walk.

Reviews.Title: “Use your GP points here,...”
Reviews.Author: VfB 1893
Reviews.Content: We spent half a week at the Hyatt Berlin, it was my second time, and I decided to return, as I stick to Hyatt wherever I can. I think the regular price is too high, and the reservation office did not agree to any kind of discount, although I book Hyatts all over the world since 2005. Hence, GP points are a OK choice if you want to avoid the price range of 300 EUR ++ per night without Breakfast. We were upgraded to a larger room, but that is standard for Diamond members. Staff was corteus, and the Grand Club is fine, although there is no nice view. Breakfast was good, the bed and bathroom excellent - similar to the Hyatt Hamburg, althouh the Hyatt Hamburg beats it´s counterpart in Berlin. Location is great (Potsdamer Platz), just close by to the Ritz and the Marriott which are sometimes cheaper than the Hyatt. Would we go again? Most likely, although the price does not really justify the poor views, and the little oldish looking furniture (green, red design). 4 out of 5 for us.

Reviews.Title: “A very good Hotel - but not the best in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt for an event for 2 nights during Fashion week. The hotel is 5*, no doubt... the location, the design, the service & especially the concierge. Rooms are "Hyatt" - so no surprise. I didn't like the smallish shower head. Internet only free if you do have higher Hyatt status (Platinum, Diamond). Breakfast, in my eyes, was disappointing. Selection not bigger than in some Club Lounges, and set up too scrambled. Anyway, outside seating a big Plus. Yes, these are small things... but Berlin has the Ritz Carlton and especially the Adlon. Why, when you're in Berlin not every week, should you stay at a chain hotel when you can have the "Adlon experience"?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - anticipating my needs - very grateful indeed”
Reviews.Author: KajsaTroften
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Grand Hyatt Berlin to attend a friend´s 50th birthday party. Of course we had very lively evenings, and hectic days which led to the inevitable stress of having breakfast. I´m a frequent traveller both for business as well as for leisure, but I´ve never so far had a person attend me at breakfast and anticipate my needs, help me to find a table quickly, and get me the very necessary Earl Greay tea and eggs in a second so I wouldn´t miss my sightseeing tour. This really impressed me - as breakfast at hotels is very nice if you have time, but can end up being stressful if you´re in a rush. By the way, the breakfast buffet is to be enjoyed as it´s very esthetically layed out as well as delicious. I found the staff very attentive, going out of their way to accompany you to find the right area you might be looking for be it elevator, bathrooms etc. The rooms are very comfortable, and as soon as you think about something and reach for it - you will find it. Not like in so many hotels where you have to search the whole room to find the shoe polish or whatever you´re looking for. Overall I understand why one of my bosses claimed this to be his favourite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel with 5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: AedhasDad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Conference, the Room was amazing and the services was second to none. Only down side i could comment on was my room was overlooked by an office block, so was glad i remembered to pack pyjamas.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: AndreeaHerzog
Reviews.Content: Went for a two days week end in Berlin and one friend recommended me to stay in the Grand Hyatt. WOW… The hotel is amazing. The room was comfortable but the best of the hotel was the SPA: Huge with a massive Jacuzzi and a great indoor pool. It is nice as there is also a terrace to get some tan. The only little issue is that it is not as well located as some other properties near the Brandenburg gate so taxi is required to enjoy the best of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this quite a lot”
Reviews.Author: EuroLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend. Really enjoyed my stay here, actually. Room -Booked a club room, with a view onto the um...shopping and theatre complex opposite. Nice clean decor, not too fussy. Liked the bathroom layout - kind of a wetroom area with the bath and shower, separated from the main section (which contains the wardrobe), with the loo separated off. -Had access to the club lounge - small but never ever full while I was there. Great service from the staff there. Good selection of teas - got addicted to the vanilla roobois while I was there. Pool -Very nice, but quite small. Gym -As with hotel gyms...small, not much in the way of free weights etc.... Location -Fine - quite a lot of dining options around Potsdamer Platz, and a metro station only a few minutes away. About 10-15 minute stroll to the Brandenberg Gate and Holocaust Memorial. Food -Went to Vox one evening, just for pudding and a coffee. I think it's one of "the places" to go in Berlin - or at least it sees itself as such. Chocolate pudding caused unintentional hilarity with the theatrical chocolate shell melted by hot sauce... -Breakfast in the club lounge wasn't bad. Good selection of breads, cold meats, fruit, cheese etc - no hot options in the lounge though, so I guess you'd need to head downstairs for that. Overall, a great stay - would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All expectations fulfilled”
Reviews.Author: Matkailija58
Reviews.Content: Probably you have heard that berliners might sometimes be quite challenging. Not at Grand Hyatt, where you are met with friendliness and courtesy. The new hotel is clean, even a bit sterile business hotel, but everything functions superbly - words which I don´t often use. Overall I personally value in a hotel quite simple things: sleep quality (quietness, reasonably hard bed and orthopedic pillow), space, ability to darken the room even during the daytime, amenities, and good, healthy breakfast. Ten points to Grand Hyatt in everything. I remembered to ask a quiet room and I got it, facing to backyard. There was even the B&O -tv and MP3-connection in the room. The service was friendly, polite and at the same time efficient. Hotel is situated close to the Tiergarten which is best place for jogging in Berlin. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: JMK-Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed on the Club Level for three nights in May. The hotel is very nice and is in a good location. The food and drink offerings at the Club lounge were varied and very good. With a late lunch, you could eat there and skip dinner. Gym and spa were fist rate. Free internet access on the 1st floor and in the Club lounge. What distinguished the hotel for me was the extremely high level of service. Everyone we dealt with spoke perfect English and was very helpful. The woman that helped us at check in was very nice and very thorough. Same for the concierge and the people that worked in the Club lounge. One of the bellhops did an amazing job of helping me when I had to return to the hotel after checking out, to retrieve my passports. I made the train with a minute to spare. Without his help I never would have caught the train.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharmalita
Reviews.Content: What I loved about this hotel was that it's a big chain with lots of rooms but yet it felt like you were important. We ended up here after being bumped from Mandala Hotel and loved the hotel - decor was very modern and rooms were on the large size. Bathrooms were huge with a wet room shower, bath, separate toilet, cupboard and sink area. There was a huge selection at breakfast and we were able to sit outside in the sun. Location was also perfect and we could walk to many of the main sites. The best bit was that we could check out at 6pm not midday like most places.

Reviews.Title: “Very good luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: hmuk09
Reviews.Content: Nice luxurious room, and great views from the pool and spa on the top floor. Good dining options too. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rezdez
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most comfortable hotels I stayed in. The rooms were beautifully decorated and very clean. The bathroom was beautiful and very comfortable. I usually don't enjoy the first night staying in hotels but in this one I immediately felt at home. Breakfast was good and nicely laid out. The hotel has an excellent swimming pool and spa with views of the city. I will definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, very few minuses”
Reviews.Author: inkjetmand
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here during an extended weekend in Berlin. Excellent service right from the start, car being parked for you, suitcases carried up, no problems during booking etc. Room found to be very nice, with nice features and details such as B&O TV, large shower/bathtub area WITH TV, very large automatic curtain that would make the room completely dark etc. Roomservice offered several times a day, any wish was fulfilled from friendly staff. A few minuses: 1) Dispite quite high room rates you STILL have to pay for WiFi access. 30 mins free, then 3€ per hour / 18 € per day. I was expecting WiFi complimentary in this hotel class. 2) Expect to be surprised in the sauna area. You exit dressing rooms into a shared shower / sauna area, where you often see naked people of both sexes that shower / do sauna. No information reveals that this area is shared. And you have to walk back through dressing rooms to get to swim area. Generally the design of this area is not well done.

Reviews.Title: “The best business hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TravlAgain
Reviews.Content: The service and staff of the hotel are excellent. You can tell that they are well-trained and their attitude about ensuring that they provide service to you as a guest is outstanding. The hotel itself is wonderful in many ways - conveniently-located on Pottsdamer Platz, making it easy to get around on the subway, central location and yet quiet a street, newer building, impeccably clean, large and comfortable rooms. The pool and spa area are on the roof, with nice views. Very relaxing. Filled with other business people in suits, so not sure it would be a great base for tourists (might feel a little too stuffy for some people). Overall, a very comfortable hotel and a nice place to stay for work.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a classy setting”
Reviews.Author: jmleon72
Reviews.Content: A group of us recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt Berlin for a vacation as we traveled through Europe. We were all impressed with the hotel's amenities and designs. Our rooms were a welcome respite from days spent sightseeing and evenings enjoying Berlin's famous nightlife. The staff was amazing---very friendly and helpful. It was really nice to be acknowledged by name throughout the property. In particular, we would like to thank Folke Grigo, the assistant front office manager. Folke gave us fantastic dinner recommendations and he showed genuine interest with his follow-up. Overall, thanks to everyone for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good at Potzdamer Platz”
Reviews.Author: oslonorwayoslo
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel with well kept rooms (even if they might be due for an update soon and the beds are not the best) and good restaurants. Especially Vox is excellent with a rather good breakfast and an evening menu featuring sushi. We also enjoyed the rooftop pool. The staff is generally excellent and made us feel welcome and comfortable. Book a Club floor room or a suite and gain access to the Club Lounge with breakfast and afternoon/early evening snacks. I am not terribly fond of Potzdamer Platz which were more in vogue a decade ago, but it is quite central and the Sony centre still is impressive with is circus tent style roof. Probably one of the top three in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: peflores
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt Berlin a few weeks. What can I say? The bed is so good you simply want to lay down for hours regardless of the many attractions this amazing city has to offer. They have an iPod/iPhone docking station with a surround system that also includes the bathroom. And yes, the bathroom is simply out of this world. I definitely recommend this hotel without any reservations. Just one tip: Travelling with a business colleague? Warning: You can see the shower from your bed no matter what you do...

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best...”
Reviews.Author: geertsnaet
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Grand Hyatt Berlin and all I can say is that it even got better. Cleanliness was top and all of the staff -without expection- are real professionals. This time I tried out both of their restaurants and there again, quality and service were tops. I also discovered the well decorated and cosy smoking room next to the bar...finaly a hotel that also respects smoking customers and does not "dump" them in a dark & smelly room in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “A WELL MANAGED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: oblimov
Reviews.Content: Was there during ITB Berlin, not easy for many Hotels to cater to during this busy period, Service from Front Office was first class,friendly and professional. The room is well laid out, great bathroom, superb water pressure. The room is large, modern good plasma TV. Room Service exceptional friendly waiters, food always tasty and well presented, A good idea to have a smoking room off the bar on the ground floor. The service was very good from the doorman through to the maid who cleaned the room. The property is in a good location only 15 minutes walk to the Brandenburg Gate and other shopping areas. The Hotel works which means the GM and his team are on the button

Reviews.Title: “Very modern”
Reviews.Author: Richie010
Reviews.Content: A very modern hotel, rooms very well equiped, plasma TVs in room and bathroom, MP3 docking stations with great sound. Very quiet rooms, breakfast - large selection and not to busy. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but service is not 5*”
Reviews.Author: TrueEnjoymentReviews
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel indeed but the service is definitely not up to par. I stayed here twice and both times I had asked housekeeping to have a specific item delivered to my room before my arrival. The first time, they forgot and I had to phone housekeeping twice (!) before it was finally delivered several hours later, which I found very irritating. I reported it all and the management made a note of it for my next stay. So before my next arrival, I again asked for that item by email - to be sure the note in my computer file would not be overlooked - and that email was confirmed. Guess what? The item wasn't in my room and when I called housekeeping they said they knew nothing about this. So it took another hour or so until it was finally delivered. Besides having to wait and change my plans, I found it most unpleasant that I not only lost time but also had to make phone calls about the item when I had sent an email to avoid just that kind on unrelaxed arrival! This is really not my idea of getting pampered at a 5* hotel. Mistakes happen, sure. But a hotel that can't even manage to fulfill a small wish like that two times in a row and despite there being clear instructions from management on my computer file, has a serious problem. Considering the enormous rates per room this really is bad value for money. The best thing about this hotel is the absolutely excellent restaurant Vox with its fantastic service, outstanding food and good wine. But then again, I can go there without having to stay at the Hyatt, can't I?

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: pacman888
Reviews.Content: Was in Berlin for 3 nights attending a business conference. Decided to stay at the Grand Hyatt instead of the conference hotel based on recommendations from friends. The Grand Hyatt Berlin is a great hotel, with wonderful staff and a very warm service. Wonderful rooms, great gym, good gym.......the list goes on. Next time I would be keen to try the rooms on the Club floor, Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experince”
Reviews.Author: kesilav
Reviews.Content: I really recommend! Fantastic services - foof, pools with view! Strategic position in the middle of the city. Higher price...

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel but shame about room location that prevented us from sleeping well”
Reviews.Author: greenstarlette
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel 5/5 but because I can count the number of hours that I slept during our multi-night stay on one hand, I can only rate it a 3/5. From the moment we walked in the hotel we were impressed and thought we made the right choice regarding where to stay in Berlin. The hotel was perfectly located within walking distance to the major sites and transportation hubs. The hotel was also located near many restaurants although we spent much of our meal times at the hotel as the hotel restaurants were impressive and delicious. We had a King Club Room which meant we were on the Club Level. The Club level gave us access to the Grand Club Lounge which featured complementary: breakfast, afternoon tea, snacks, beverages & alcoholic drinks. The room itself was modern and well decorated. We also enjoyed the Aveda bath products. The only shame about this hotel was that we did not sleep well either night we were there! We had a corner room and although it was on a high floor, it was incredibly noisy! The entire night we heard people partying outside and cars speeding by revving their engines. It was awful! We asked to switch rooms (we even said we'd downgrade to a smaller, non club level room or even have 2 separate beds) but the hotel said they were all sold out and did not have a single room to move us to. They offered apologies but that was all. I was disappointed that even after another consecutive night of not being able to sleep and asking again to move rooms that the hotel only apologized again but said there was nothing they could do. I found it hard to believe they were completely sold out and I was disappointed they couldn't move us to a room of someone that hadn't checked in to yet. I wish I could say I would return to this hotel as the hotel itself was lovely however, the devil was in the details and as our lack of sleep put a damper on our enjoyment of our Berlin vacation I can only recommend the hotel if you get an interior facing room or perhaps avoid staying there during the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kvitochka
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt Berlin features great location, as well as facilities, amenities and excellent service. Very classy and innovative hotel with clean design of the guestrooms and modern art works in public areas. My room was specious and light with big Bang and Olufsen plasma screen in living room as well as small extra screen in bathroom. Also bathroom features heated floors (special advantage for winter time!). What else? ... large working desk with good lighting, complimentary tea and coffee facilities in the room.... even some books to read! And the service was really excellent. The only confusion that I experienced - I really couldn't switch off this fancy B&O TV set, trying all the buttons on remote control! But it was even a bit of fun :)) Seems like Hyatt this time was more innovative than me... I would definitely recommend this hotel for every visitor of Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “what an amazing hotel, I consider myself well travelled and its a cracker!”
Reviews.Author: jacqui7206
Reviews.Content: We arrived in what for my inmitial tastes looked to be a contemporary, modern hotel, Im always concerned that this will equal a cold atmosphere, but not at all here, its tastefully done, the bedrooms are beautiful and bathrooms stunning! I know not something that you normally "write home" about. It well positioned, we walked to all that we wanted to see,... the museums, art galleries checkpoint charlie shopping to us was all easily walked. I would recomend it to all

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: expatsing
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for one night only while in Berlin. I was impressed on the hotel, the room was spacious, with a great entertainement system and nice bathroom. I loved the gym, one of the best I have seen, with great views. The location is also very good with a shopping mail just behind and many other shops around!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_8
Reviews.Content: This will be one of those hotels I remember and compare others to. There's very little wrong with it. Firstly, please note, this is geared as a business hotel and is run by a corporate chain so you won't have the personalised touches that you would from a family run hotel. Location: It's 3-5 mins walk from Potsdamer Platz on the S-Bahn and U-Bahn. Berlin is slightly too spread for most people to walk only and the train/metro(tube, subway) comes in very handy. I would recommend the 3/5/7 day tourist travelcard as it gives you a discount to tourist attractions and is only a little bit more than the usual 3/5/7 day travelcards.There's a shopping centre opposite if you find you've forgotten anything or wish to buy anything. Room: The bed is very comfortable, room spacious and bathroom is decent size with separate shower and bath. Also separate toilet cubicle, albeit within the bathroom. The things which i really liked were the little touches like; the heated floor in the bathroom, tv in the bathroom with speakers, apples in the fruit bowl, apple dock connected to the tv and aveda products in the bathroom. Spa/Swimming facilities: I didn't use the gym but the swimming pool is a really decent size for an indoor pool and has quite a nice view of the concert halls nearby. The jacuzzi is lovely, especially after a long cold day. There is also a steam room, sauna, plunge pool and relaxation area. Towels, robes, slippers and toiletries are all provided within the spa area and there is always staff around to help. I didn't eat at the restaurants which appeared to be a little dear, from what I can remember and room service which was also in line with 4/5* hotels which I also didn't try. If I return to Berlin, this will be the first place I will check for prices and availability.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Leningrad90
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend the Grand Hyatt in Berlin highly enough. The staff are friendly and the service is excellent - they go out of their way to ensure that you enjoy your stay. I would recommend paying extra for a Club room on 7th floor, so that you can enjoy the relaxed atmosphere and personal service provided in the Club Lounge - a welcome retreat on a very cold day. The spa and pool area are very good too, with great views across the city.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: sopenick
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (by Potsdamer Platz, 5 mins from Musical instrument museum and Sony Centre with English language cinema and Berlin Phil; 10 min walk to Holocaust Memorial, 15/20 min walk to Brandenburg Gate). Stayed in Executive King on 7th floor - fabulous rooms with most amazing bathrooms ever! Half normal bathroom with underfloor heating, and half wetroom (with pull across door). Incredibly comfortable King size bed - slept like a log. Access to Exec Club Lounge with breakfast and coffees, teas, drinks and water included. Service could not have been better - our flight home was cancelled and they phoned the airline for me, spoke in German, then handed the phone across to me for me to hear that my flight had been rebooked for 3 hrs later.
