I put the phone down and they handed me my new key cards having automatically extended our late check out for another 3 hrs free of charge! Cannot recommend highly enough - would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best”
Reviews.Author: alexb2
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed in worldwide. Superb service from each and every member of staff. Beautiful large bathrooms. Automated blackout blinds. Good breakfast buffet. 2 minutes walk to S and U Bahn. If you book in advance you can get an excellent weekend rate at the sub-200 EUR level with b/fast, which is a steal for this city and this location. I challenge anyone to find a better hotel in Berlin at this rate. You simply won't. The only minor niggle: the water in the rooftop pool was too chilly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SohanTanna
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a very nice hotel. Right around the corner from the Sony Center and Ritz Carlton. The check in staff were great, offered to take me to the room incase I didn't know where it was. The room was very clean and nice, bathroom was absolutely awsome. Hotel was absolutely great from the check in to check out, with friendly staff and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hyatt Service and Quality”
Reviews.Author: amlash
Reviews.Content: The Berlin Hyatt is a fantastic hotel! It is similar to the Park Hyatt properties in Washington DC, Chicago, Milan and Paris. The rooms are sleek and comfortable with wonderful bathrooms. The fitness center is outstanding. The service is impeccable - probably the best I have encounterned in the past several years. The location could not be beat - right in the heart of downtown Berlin - and accessible to all attractions and transportation. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “luxury, location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: suzzieNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Berlin. The Grand Hyatt Berlin is outstanding....which is a lot for me to say because 5 stars never seems to be good enough. I rate this hotel 6 stars. We shopped and got a great price on Jetsetter for a king size double room....so we were particularly happy with the price. The room was gorgeous. Every object in it was significantly beautiful. The bathroom was wonderful. The employees were friendly and personable. The view from the rooftop pool was terrific. Location couldn't be better. Complaints?None! I can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed it”
Reviews.Author: Elitaste
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here in August for work and it was amazing. Top to bottom one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in...location, service, food, etc.

Reviews.Title: “IMPECCABLE SERVICE from EVERYONE working in the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pertasia
Reviews.Content: I'm actually speechless with the quality of service from every person working in the hotel - from the concierge to front desk, to hotel breakfast staff ... When you ask for something or anything, their reply is always -- WITH PLEASURE! The hotel itself is cozy, modern and relaxing... Breakfast was so enjoyable and delicious, too! Thank you for a wonderful, unforgettable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ReisenderCH
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Berlin is located at Potsdamer Platz, within walking distance to Brandenburger Tor. Rooms: Modern, large and great bathrooms. Restaurants/Bars: Only tried the bar and that was fine. Wellness: OK Fitness room (on the small side) but great wellness area and large pool. Overall a good choice. Would also recommend the Ritz Carlton if you get it for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “nice service”
Reviews.Author: swissguest
Reviews.Content: In Berlin for a business trip, so a short trip. Nice room, but nothing special compared to other Hyatt I visited. Really liked the pool and view from the Gym. Kind of a strange smell in the Sauna zone though. Good and friendly service

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: JustATraveller26
Reviews.Content: Very good, modern hotel in a convenient (a short walk distance from a city tour bus) and quiet location. The staff was very responsive and polite, the restaurant had a very delicious food, the rooms were very clean and comfortable, with no unpleasant smells anywhere in the hotel. The only slightly negative thing I've noticed is that in my room the second TV (in the bathroom) was not working at all, which was not a big deal since I didn't want to use it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: macsym
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very well situated for visiting Berlin. It is attractively appointed, well maintained and the staff I encountered (with one exception) were very friendly and helpful. Natalie and Gaan in the Club Lounge; Karl from room service; Edgar from Vox and Sven from Concierge all deserve special mention. The few minor problems encountered were all quickly and efficiently dealt with in a most gracious manner. It was a pleasure to stay here and I would certainly return and recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: cosmoproletVienna
Reviews.Content: Check- in at 9:30 (evening) was smooth - we were upgraded to a club floor room (GP Diamond). The rooms are spacious, modern and clean, characteristics of the whole hotel. The staff is friendly and genuinely caring for the guest. We had dinner at Vox which was fantastic. It's not cheap but it's worth the money. Pool and spa area are outstanding. The are overlooking the roofs of Berlin and there is a terrace outside. Service in the club-lounge was great, the hostess was friendly and seemed to love her job. However food options were limited for happy hour. Hotel can be highly recommended. Go there when in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: so_traveller
Reviews.Content: Location: I think Potsdamer Platz is a good location for first time tourist to Berlin. It's a little bit tricky using the Airport Express Bus (X9) and metro from the Zoological Station to Potsdamer Platz, but you should be ok once you get orientated. It's about 10-15 minutes walk to Brandenburger Tor and Unter de Linder Ave, and about the same to Checkpoint Charlie, maybe a bit longer. If you don't want to walk you can use the metro - the S/U Bahn is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Service: Excellent. The check-in receptionist was very friendly and welcoming. The main staff in the Regency Club, Natalie, was exceptionally friendly and professional. The staff in the Vox restaurant were also a pleasure. Food: Great breakfast spread in the Regency Club. The cocktail hours snacks were excellent also. The Vox restaurant was very good - great location eating outside people watching. I think it's great for the value compare to similar types of restaurants in US. Gym/Pool: Awesome pool on the top floor with great view. The gym is above average for hotel gym. There's a relaxation room in the locker/sauna area that's great after a day of sightseeing. Room: Very interesting layout as people have reported. Not huge room, but does not feel cramp. The room feels very plush and the amenities are all very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: montgolfier
Reviews.Content: Partner and I had a great weekend at the Grand Hyatt; staff were very helpful; nice wellness area on top of the building with a sensational view over Potsdamer Platz. Spacious rooms, still in a very good condition. The hotel restaurant is excellent, great food, the wine too expensive though. We had a club floor room; the lounge offerend a good choice for breakfast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulo260
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel two weeks ago and the experience was great. Staff were realy wonderful as was the location, best area to stay while visiting Berlin with top quality inexpensive restaurants on your doorstep. Rooms were spacious and very hip. Only complaint was the bed was slightly hard for me but i do like mine extra soft. Pool and gym were a bonus so clean with plenty of equipment. I would highly recommend this hotel. Only other word of caution is the cost of the breakfast. 32 euros per person for a buffett no matter how good, and no matter how great the service is over the top. Unfortunately we didnt check the prices until after our second day - ouch. There are plenty of places nearby to eat and the shopping mall opposite has numerous eateries. So only minor personal gripes, but will definately return. Paul

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLemmy
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at the Hyatt. The staff are very helpful and friendly and the facilities are exemplary. Dinner at its Vox restaurant was great and swimming in the top-floor pool was wonderful. Love the art too. I think it would be hard to find a better hotel than this...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Perfect Location for Exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Niamhie001
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in the Hyatt Berlin. Location at Potsdam Platz is great for exploring Berlin, near Sony Center, ten minute walk to Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag and Checkpoint Charlie (in opposite directions!). Room spacious and comfortable, staff couldn't do enough for you, would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: rpitton
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend and really like the location and the hotel. Staff was extremly welcome and showed us to the room which was very modern and wit all amenities needed. Hotel restraurant is excellend for dinner and breakfast. The weather was so nice that we not tried the great pool and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooftop Spa, Great Design of Rooms, Delicious Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EHGZurich
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have ever been too. Everything in this hotel is very good, if not perfect: the design of the rooms, the sleep quality, the unique rooftop swimming pool, the open show kitchen and the breakfast buffet...

Reviews.Title: “Best Roof top spa...”
Reviews.Author: yoonie00
Reviews.Content: It is not so much that it is on top of a beautiful place, nor that it is a large space where you can really relax. It is how they laid out the space that interested and comforted me. No wonder it is one of those spaces where people keep coming back for. I also liked the fact that they have separate elevators to reach the spa so that you do not feel awkward walking around in a bath robe and bumping into other clients. I would go there just for the roof top garden. Lets not forget the food on offer - there is a sushi restaurant on the ground floor which looks like a place you want to hang around with cool friends in a cool outfit, but there is also the cafe/restaurant where you can get great hamburgers (really yummy and healthy!) and really good asian food as well (soup and wantans and springrolls if I remember this correctly). The rooms, my, my. Again the layout. I liked it! very unusual in a nice surprise kind of way. Do visit. I will too!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service”
Reviews.Author: cacktusjack
Reviews.Content: We booked the Grand Hyatt because of the proximity to the Berliner Philharmonie. It's a beautiful design-oriented 5* hotel with average-sized rooms but perfect service. All the staff were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the Lounge on Club Level with a nice selection of drinks and food items during the day. Also recommend the new "Mesa" tapas-restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay I've ever had in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: travelin4life
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is the epitome of "new Berlin" - modern, spacious, technologically savvy. Rooms are high-tech and incredibly comfortable, a tad bit expensive but worth every Euro. Staff was friendly and welcoming to us as non-German speaking Americans. Location is within walking distance and/or a short train or cab ride from all the landmarks and across the street from some terrific shopping. We were there for a week and I wish we could have stayed longer....can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe hotel--nice location”
Reviews.Author: lhs76
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the "concierge" floor, which entitled us to breakfast, a complementary afternoon tea with pastries, and snacks between six and eight o'clock that were substantial enough to qualify as a light dinner. Lobby and room decor is modern and attractive. The fitness center is well-equipped with nice views of the city as you pedal on your elliptical or pound away on your treadmill. It also has a nice big swimming pool. In the hotel is the restaurant "Vox", which usually has live jazz after l0:00, "Mesa," a tapas bar, and "Tizian," a lounge and restaurant adjacent to the lobby. We liked the location, which is in a lively area, and an easy walk to the concert hall and a couple of museums. Personnel were friendly and helpful, particularly the concierge Sebastian.

Reviews.Title: “It is not worth of money”
Reviews.Author: Habilli
Reviews.Content: I am not impressed with this hotel at all. It is not worth for the money you pay. Firstly, my newspaper was never delivered for the both days I stayed. , internet was pretty expensive 18 Euros. Also, they charge few euros more than 18 euros so check the bill. Despite what reception says the room had both wireless and wired internet but if you use both I suppose you get charged both. I was not very impressed with the reception either.The heating system did not function properly so one of the hotel staff turned up with a foot heater which remind me my cold flat in London. When you ordered a tab water in the lobby they give you warm tab water at least you would expect to served cold one. Also, they charge for free satellite channels. Make sure that put your do not disturb sign up as one of the hotel staff might come in without knocking the door. There was a very friendly concierge helped us for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A very smart, efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: topfuel
Reviews.Content: Mine was a short stay. Glad i had a driver as to find this hotel as a first time visitor would have a nightmare. In the centre but down 1 way streets. However, it's lovely. Staff are superb. An interesting point is that i have never had to use my electronic door key to use the elevators. Also when i was there the 2nd floor where i was staying smelt of sewage..not nice. But, everything else was first class. Checkin and check out was simple and easy. The rooms are very funky. Wet rooms for bathrooms and the bathroom decor very nice. All in first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual”
Reviews.Author: slecombre
Reviews.Content: One short night of joy in a great hotel. Truly 5 stars which come at a price, but it is well worth it. Fast and welcoming check-in, you are offered help with your luggage and get all the absic explanation about hotel settings. Every room (even the most basic ones) are spacious. They feature a great bathroom with two doors (one on the room corridor, another one directly to the bed area) which add a feeling of space. Decoration is modern yet not overly designed, great TV and a link to get your mp3 music played into the room (including bathroom of course) And the service, turn down service around 6pm. Bottle of water at your bed, tv program opened at the right page.... all the details that really make 5 stars hotel. Do not miss the Spa and teh swimmingpool overlooking Berlin. It's just great. Strongly recommanded

Reviews.Title: “True hospitality”
Reviews.Author: geertsnaet
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the hotel and -being a hotelier myself- all I can say that this was a perfect stay. The room and especially the bathroom are clean, spacy and very comfortable. I had breakfast in my room every day. It was always delivered within 10 minutes by very friendly and helpful waiters. Throughout the hotel all the staff is extremely polite, friendly and helpful...they really make you feel special. On my last day, a gentlemen approached me in the lobby and inquired how I was doing and whether my stay had been fine...it turned out to be the Hyatt Area Vice President, Mr. Hurst. This is what I call "Leading by Example" and this is how great hotels are being made Congratulations to the entire Grand Hyatt Team in Berlin and...keep on following your Leader !!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: YoshiDus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on of my longstanding favourites in Berlin. Expect top-notch stylish rooms and service at it´s best. If you can afford, take a suite with views of Marlene Dietrich Platz. Another highlight is the perfect Spa as well as the awesome Pool on top of the Grand Hyatt. The Bar is one of the Hot-Spots in town. Only small "downside": the lovley Grand Club Lounge has just views of the inner courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “the friendliest germans, dreamy bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: stevencoxflowers
Reviews.Content: Loved the staff at the Grand Hyatt Berlin. They were all warm and lovely people. The bathrooms have to be the coolest on the planet! I want one at home.

Reviews.Title: “A first class business hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: DCG
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Hyatt Grand in Berlin on business. I have not stayed previously at any Hyatt properties as I am a great fan of Four Seasons but there is none in Berlin so I had little choice. Most of the other major hotels were fully booked as it was Berlin Fashion Week so good hotels were hard to come by. I am a bit of a hotel junkie and am very critical. However, this hotel exceeded all of my very very high expectations in every department and it was a bit of a revelation. The room was perfect for my needs and it was beautifully appointed and extremely comfortable. I have a theory that you will always find something wrong in every hotel room you stay in - with the exception of the Four Seasons George V in Paris which is just hotel perfection. I have to say that The Hyatt Grand Berlin is the only other hotel I have ever stayed in which matched the George V in this respect. The staff were just brilliant. The restaurant - called Vox - provided an outstanding breakfast buffet with an amazing choice and very helpful staff. I had dinner in Vox on one evening and it was wonderful. Incredibly good sushi, great wine list and elegant efficient service. I cannot think of even one single aspect of my stay which could have been improved on. Well done Hyatt and thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: oslo000
Reviews.Content: Landed at Schönefeld airport some 45 min outside the city. Had arranged for a driver from the hotel to come and pick us up, and was driven to the hotel in what I think is a S-class Mercedes. The car is nice, but for me being 190cm there was not enough room in the backseat. Anyway... Arrived at the hotel which is located near Potsdamer Platz, an important public square and traffic intersection in the centre of Berlin. Friendly front-desk welcome, and quick checkin. We were then taken to our hotelroom, which you can see on the pictures. A standard Grand Hyatt room, with B&O LCD TV, and a huge bathroom in dark wood an granite. We didn`t eat breakfast at the hotel so can not comment on that, but the roomservice was very good. Ordered both club-sandwich and sushi. Check-out was quick and easy. We took a taxi to the airport, and not the mercedes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid1
Reviews.Content: Unlike some others, I don't reserve rave reviews for hotels due to their cost; rather I give them when I think they are deserved and I enthusiastically give five big ones to the Hyatt. The staff...from the initial check-in, to the guys on the door to the folks in the "Club" room and the housekeeping staff..each and every one was friendly, helpful, and more than willing to assist with whatever needs... I stayed in a Club Deluxe king room and these have been described adequately in other reviews. Everything worked and there is plenty of space including in the bathroom..worth the money IMO. The Club facility was very nice and the staff truly outstanding; nice food and beverage offerings throughout the day. The pool and hot tub with the incredible view over the city was a very welcome extra. The location of the hotel was ideal for me and on this trip..normally I stay in other parts of the city but would certainly consider this again. Overall an excellent stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: GeoMedic
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five-day stay at this hotel. I get very, very little vacation time and the time I do take I have high expectations for. The Grand Hyatt Berlin not only lived up to those expectations, it surpassed them. Very few places get the full 5 stars from me in review. Only places I'd sacrifice to stay at get the highest grade. This is one of them. Location: about two blocks from the Potsdamer Banhoff and U station, in the heart of an mid-upscale shopping and hotel area (the Marriott and the Ritz Carelton are nearby). We arrived on an early morning flight which put us at the hotel at about 09:30. Our room was ready for us and they allowed us immediate access to it, which worked well for a three hour power nap. We were escorted to the room by the service oriented front desk attendant, which was a nice touch. We stayed in a Club King on the 7th floor (the highest floor with rooms). Its window looked out over the city. While a courtyard room would have been quieter, we anticipated better ventilation and coolness from an outside room. It was a spacious room with a king bed, nice flat screen TV (is there any other kind these days?), an oval desk, and night stands. The bathroom was large with a separate toilet cubicle. The bathroom floor was marble (alabaster actually, but I get technical) and was heated. The shower and tub are partitioned off by large sliding glass doors and take up an area equal or larger than many hotel room bathrooms I've been in. For those of you in the know, the soap/shampoo is Aveda. They advertise that the room windows open and they do... tilting open from the top, and even with the electrically operated light block screen most of the way down, provided good air circulation and coolness through the night. The only thing that I would want to improve about the room was the bed. It was quite firm. While by no means uncomfortable, it wasn't the best I've had either (Marriott consistently has the best upscale beds). We asked for an additional comforter and slept on that for our stay. Even that little bit made a difference. The beds need at least a minimal topper to be great. As it stands now they are merely good. Linens were very high quality and the pillows, the bane of some hotels were excellent. Security: In room safe, elevators require key card, front desk seems to monitor the elevator lobby well, and the room doors are big, thick, and heavy. Fire exits were clear and well marked (I've learned from experience that this matters). We had access to the Grand Club Lounge and used it for breakfast, afternoon cake, and evening appetizers/wine. The Club attendants were excellent, learning quickly what we liked to drink and remembering it through the week. The food was simply some of the best I've had in a hotel lounge. The afternoon cakes, apparently a German tradition, was excellent, and I am certainly not a cake person. We made an excuse to be near the hotel around "cake time" (3PM) every day. I wish we had done more of the gourmet evening appetizers as the ones we had were superb, but hey... you can't hang around the hotel all the time. I have attached a picture of the Club Lounge to this review. All in all, it was one of the best hotel stays I've had and certainly the best Hyatt stay. We will return and we highly recommend this location to any and all.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are great”
Reviews.Author: jkgvfg
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Hyatt. Location is handy for Potsdamer Platz area. The rooms are the nicest I have stayed in for a city hotel. TV was at least a 36", channels weren't the best variety for english speakers (news only) but you can plug your MP3 player into the TV sound system and listen to it in the bathroom. Breakfast was varied and of good standard. Only disappointment with the whole hotel was the spa area. The sauna area was limited, one sauna, one steamroom, one plunge pool and that was about it and it was separated from the pool area. But spent the days in the Thermen am Europa Center which made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Super-class”
Reviews.Author: Flipendo
Reviews.Content: A super-class hotel, placed near Postdamer Platz. The location is excellent for shopping and entertainment. The hotel is fantastic, everything from food to rooms deserves applauses. Sure, is a very expensive one - as long as I know, a room is around 450 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesTraveldiva
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days vacation at the end of August., and then went on to Prague for business. Thoroughly enjoyed the Grand Hyatt. Excellent staff who were very helpful. We found the rooms to be very well appointed - they seem to anticipate a travelers needs. The rooms have comfortable beds though not pillow top, and the rooms were exceptionally quiet. Breakfast buffet was wonderful, and the restaurants are great. The hotel is in a good location, easy walk to the Gate. Downsides were the high price for internet access. Will certainly stay here when we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Mobility Alert- 15 Stairs up to the pool and hot tub!”
Reviews.Author: hopegoodeNyc
Reviews.Content: We were surprised that a hotel built only 10 years ago would not have a lift directly to the pool level but such is the situation. That said, if this is not an issue for you, it was one of my favorite hotel stays. The rooms have wonderful tubs and it is fun to watch tv while taking a bath. The technological advances are instructive; I wonder if all the new Hyatts being constructed require the room key to be inserted to turn on the room lights- great conservation tool. The breakfast buffet outshone all others in our travels. Not only were there remarkable cheese selections but also fish- smoked salmon, sturgeon, and sable. The fresh pastries and, even cake, were hard to resist each morning.The salad ingredients added variety to the usual egg preparations. Do try to do your booking with breakfast. As previous posters mentioned, the staff is superb. The concierges all were most helpful and the service-oriented attitude added so much to the stay. I look forward to returning and hope that Hyatt can make the pool accessible in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: shoshanna-rose
Reviews.Content: When we first entered the hotel, the minimalist design seemed a bit cold and off putting. We did, however, quickly change our mind. The staff were incredibly helpful. The room was large and the location turned out to be better than expected. Some of the S lines were down due to construction and we were able to walk to most signts and take the U2 line right outside the hotel. We got a FABULOUS deal through 1800 hotels that made the hotel very affordable and breakfast was included. The breakfast was so large that we skipped lunch most days and treated ourselves to a nice dinner. Minor complaint about the shower water pressure - but I complain about that at almost every hotel. Also, we found the hotel difficult to find when returning to Potsdamer Platz each day. That was probably our bad sense of direction but the layout of Potsdamer Platz was a bit confusing. Also, no free internet access in your room and you were charged an exorbitant fee. There was free access in the lobby but you couldn't use your own computer. It was, however, a great five night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: WalshDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from a 3 night's stay at the Grand Hyatt in Berlin for our wedding anniversary. The hotel is well designed, extremely comfortable and the service is exemplary and unobtrusive. We stayed in a Grand Club room and the additional services in the Grand Club were well worth it - charming staff The room was extremely well equipped and spacious. The hotel management went to extra effort to ensure we had a memorable wedding anniversary and it was very much appreciated by us. Finally, the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: BillyBMerseyside
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days at this hotel. For some reason it was considerably cheaper with 1800hotels (and it was with breakfast). Everything about the place is great. The staff ( and I mean all the staff we met ) are probably the best we've met anywhere. It was my wifes 60th (reason for the break),the hotel staff where aware of this and at 'the birthday meal', in the hotel's magnificent Vox restaurant, they gave us a bottle of champagne and birthday cake , a birthday present from the manager. The location is perfect for seeing the main sites in Berlin. Many are within walking distance. We had a 'Welcome Card' and used to either get the 200 bus or hop on the train. The bus stop is over the road and the station is 5 minutes away. My wife and I loved Berlin. The Grand Hyatt is an outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: tereads
Reviews.Content: The level of service and the thoughtfully appointed accomodations were wonderful. All requests and inquiries were attended to promptly and with a great deal of care and pride. We couldn't have been more impressed or better taken care of. The great thing was the pleasure everyone seemed to take in making things as comfortable and smooth-running as possible. Service makes all the difference!!

Reviews.Title: “An Urban Oasis, Chic and Serene”
Reviews.Author: ElMusaferain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt Berlin for a week of sightseeing, and it proved an excellent choice. The central location in the revitalized Potsamerplatz makes for easy travel anywhere in the city, on foot, on public transport, or by taxi; at the same time, the hotel's many facilities make it easy to combine shopping, museums, etc., with downtime in the pool, spa, or club lounge (a worthwhile upgrade). The Grand Deluxe King room was spacious, well-laid out, and greatly enhanced by the luxurious bathroom with its separate bath/shower room. We had a courtyard rather than street view, but that was pleasant, green, and quiet rather than claustrophobic (and the views in the neighborhood are nice enough but not especially dramatic). The usual fabulous Hyatt bed, of course, along with a comfortable chair, nice work area, and plenty of room for unpacking. Throughout the hotel, the design is crisp, modern, and simple, without being austere or sacrificing a sense of elegance - I thought of it as having a contemporary, subtle luxury, as opposed to a more "olde world" avalanche of velvet drapes and gilt. Access to the 7th floor club was a major asset, with a delicious light breakfast daily until 11 (12 on Saturdays and a luxurious 2 on Sundays), sweets in the afternoon, and cocktails (beer and wine) and tasty snacks in the evening (6-8). The house sekt was excellent, and the canapes inventive and ample. The club staff is superlative - friendly, professional, and very welcoming. We spent a lot of time in the rooftop indoor pool, small but well-appointed, and in the spa, which is excellent. My only quibbles about the hotel are that the pool/spa admits children (it's not really child friendly and gets loud), that at 18 Euros a day Internet access (while very fast) is not cheap, and that the room service menu is limited, especially given the range and quality of the hotel's three restaurants. All in all, though, the Grand Hyatt is a marvelous place to stay, wonderful in itself and surrounded by the restaurants, museums, shops, and other attractions of this renewed part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “It can't get much better”
Reviews.Author: revilo77Dubai
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Grand Hyatt Potsdamer Platz during ITB. Working for a luxury hotel company myself you can imagine my benchmarks are quite high. This hotel however has overwhelmed me with luxurious service from the moment I arrived. The first time I stayed there I was greeted by my name when a friendly bellboy opened the door of my taxi. This time however I was greeted and welcomed back. Check-in only took a minute as they had my credit card details on file and I also got the same room like the year before. A friendly young man accompanied me to my room and offered to have my suits pressed and my shirts ironed for the trade show. The room is adequate for a deluxe room with nice features like B&O TV, small TV in the bathroom and walk-in shower. The bed is very comfortable and I also enjoyed the high class complimentary bottle of water that was replenished every day. I ordered room service once which was promptly deliverd and tasted delicious. The lobby bar is also very nice and the drinks are made like they should be. You actually taste the Gin in your GT - not very common anymore. Overall an excellent experience. I am looking forward to staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Wine_and_Foody
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt in Potsdamer Platz is one of my favourite city hotels. The room is modern, elegant and very quiet with a lovely bathroom and firm comfortable bed. Other hotels that I would compare it to are the Peninsula in New York or Chicago, and the St. Regis in San Francisco. The restaurant in the hotel (Vox) has excellent food and a great bar featuring a huge selection of whiskeys and a top notch mixologist, as well as live music on the weekends. Don't miss the breakfast which has a huge selection of excellent pastries, breads, omelets or eggs on demand, yogourts, fruits, cereals, juices, meats and cheeses. The location is very close to the Potsdamer Platz underground station and train station, and many restaurants and other night life. I don't plan on staying anywhere else when I visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rcoimbra
Reviews.Content: Great staff, very helpful and polite. The room´s are very good with a nice bathroom. The restaurants are great, you have Mesa were you can eat some small great dishes, you can choose from a list several one´s (not expensive, cheap really) and the environment is great and relaxed and you have Vox, were you can eat in a another environment, Japanese food or an other delicate dish (expensive). The spa is very good also, had some great massages! The Hotel is very central and very well decorated.

Reviews.Title: “extremely poor security when it was essential”
Reviews.Author: mosxojuan
Reviews.Content: This weekend berlin hosts the basketball euroleague final 4,in which two greek teams particiapate,panathinaikos and olympiakos. People here in germany are supposed to be informed about the way the hooligans in greece act, and high security measures where supposed to be taken .I am staying in the hyatt hotel, in which the team of olympiakos happens to be staying as well. i am only mentioning that because in the case, security should be even more empowered.instead, just outside the hotel,whithin the hotel premises, i was attacked by 10 olympiakos hooligans trying to take of my shirt and of course trying to hit me in anyway they can..luckily i wasnt hurt but this is not the point.the point is that that the hotels security was prooved absolutely useless in one of the three hotel entrances, not being able to understand a word of english, and ofcourse the police which is supposed to be alert in berlin this weekend came 50 mins after the incident.ofcourse rather than that,this is a very nice hotel to stay, but ofcourse it is also very expensive, so the least oit could be is to be nice.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TigerBait
Reviews.Content: I finally logged on to post my review of the hotel, but have little to add that is not covered in GEOFFS3's review below. This was an extremely nice place to stay. The room was very comfortable, the staff was helpful, and I enjoyed the breakfast in the main restaurant and the late dinner in the tapas bar. But the best thing about the hotel was probably the location, since it was very easy to get out to see the sights of Berlin. When writing a review, I always try to look for some negatives to balance out the positives, but that was hard to do here. The only negative I can think of is the high cost for internet access. That's a cost that you're willing to accept on a business trip, but it would be much more distasteful on a holiday. Then again, there are a lot of things that you can do on holiday in Berlin instead of sitting in your room and surfing the internet!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in a very long time......”
Reviews.Author: GEOFFS3
Reviews.Content: Out of all the reviews I have posted on TripAdvisor, this is probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in. I was expecting nice, but they exceeded my expectations. We stayed 4 nights in a Grand Club Twin room (club level). Location: Excellent. Very central to almost all of Berlin. It's very close (walkable) to all the major attractions and subway access is close. The hotel is adjacent to a major mall/entertainment complex with a lot of offer. Rooms: Posh. For Europe, rather large rooms with very comfortable bedding. The bathrooms are almost as large as the room (larger than some NYC hotel rooms I have stayed in) and very spa-like. Great Aveda products and almost every amenity you would need. Staff: Very professional, very efficient, very accomodating. By all means, they get the idea of "service", albeit with a German style. I would say it's equivelant to a Ritz-Carlton in the US. Public Space: The lobby is modern and gorgeous. I did not use any of the restaurants or room service. Nor did I try the 8th floor Spa...although I hear it's quite nice. The club level offered a lounge with quite an elaborate spread for breakfast, high tea, and evening appetizers. Also free wine, beer, soda, and juices. The lounge was awesome and really was a nice perk - especially with the free computer use they offer as well. This hotel is a bit pricey, but if you can pull it off......go for it! Consider it a splurge. It really made our trip to Berlin!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay, room was great!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkynana
Reviews.Content: When we opened the door to our room, it was really great! Loved the sort of open bathroom room concept with sliding doors, the room was clean and well designed, also had B&O TV. Our room was facing the office block, and we can see people working through our windows... so better make sure your curtain are shut to ensure privacy. One big thing that was a let down was that on our 2nd day, our bathroom amenities were not refilled, we ran out of shampoo and shower gel....we thought maybe it was Hyatt's new cost cutting initiative? This is such a basic thing.... what a let down! We went for a swim and the jacuzzi at the top of the hotel after walking about Berlin the whole day. It was a very nice and relaxing experience,esp the jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “10/10 stay at the Hyatt Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ZippyLondon
Reviews.Content: From the moment you pull up to the lobby you know this place has the 'X' factor in terms of style, service, location and luxury. The property is very much in line with the Hyatt style with cool music playing in the background, comfy lounge chairs and smart and attentive staff. Check-in was smooth and efficient even though we turned up at 10:30AM when most hotels would be quite sniffy and send you off with a flea in your ear along the lines of "you're too early". The room was very well appointed with a B&O TV and another small one in the large luxury bathroom. Some very nice touches in the room and floor to ceiling windows. We had a problem with the bed and was swiftly upgraded to a bigger, swishier room with an even bigger B&O TV. Gorjus!. Great spa/pool on the top floor with great views over the city but the prudish should be aware; Germanic 'open-ness' prevails in the mixed (and nude) sauna/steam-room and plunge pools. The hotel is situated very close to a shopping mall and there are plenty of places to get a bargain breakfast (the bagel place Salomons is tip-top), Check-Point Charlie is very close as is the National Gallery and plenty of great walks. A top stay in a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Grand Hyatt Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MadamLucyLuLu
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a lovely weekend at this hotel. We booked the L'Amour package so we got B&B plus champagne and strawberries on arrival (even though we checked in at 10.30pm). It's well worth getting one of their packages even if it's just to get the breakfast included in the price. The Hyatt breakfast was very good and we had it in our room each morning at no extra cost. The staff were all very friendly and helpful without being too forward. We got room service the first night. There wasn't much choice for vegetarians so I opted for spaghetti with sauce, which was quite boring. Luckily I also ordered a rocket salad which was very good. My partner got salmon and roast vegetables which he really enjoyed. The room itself (Grand King) was comfortable although not very big. The bed was very nice and it was possible to order extra pillows and bedding if required. We were happy with it as it was. There was a flat screen TV (Bang & Olufsen). There were also speakers in the ceiling of the bathroom which was cool. You could lie in the bath and listen to your tunes or watch TV as there was also a smaller flat screen TV in the bathroom. There's a connector cable provided so it's possible to plug your MP3 player or laptop into the system. My only complaint was that the bathroom had sliding doors. One opened directly beside the bed. None of the sliding doors sealed very well which meant there was very little privacy when you used the toilet etc.. The spa was very nice. It wasn't too busy so we had an enjoyable swim etc.. Wireless internet cost 50 cent per minute with a maximum charge of €18 for a 24 hour period. The location of the hotel is very good. It was clean and to a good standard. The only downside for me was that the bathroom didn't feel like a separate room. Overall we had a lovely time there and we would happily go there again. If you are going, look for a package which includes breakfast, it's well worth the little extra.

Reviews.Title: “Fanstastic”
Reviews.Author: Joethting
Reviews.Content: What can I say, it's a real 5-star. Contemporary, 1 huge plasma tv in the room and another little one in the bathroom. Awesome

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Hyatt Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: JamesL.
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in Germany and our stay at the Grand Hyatt Berlin was one of the main highlights. We were fortunate to book the Max Reinhardt Suite/620. There are so many side benefits to booking this suite that the value is worth the extra price. Limo service to and from the airport, an amazing buffet breakfast (Vox-not to be missed) complimentary mini-bar, and many other meals, snacks and drink specials. All areas of service were exceptional, from the front desk to the various bars/restaurants. Completely modern in all phases, the room was huge, comfortable and spotless. Outside of a mattress that was pretty hard (not their usual Heavenly Bed) there are no complaints. Perfect location as well. Central to all the sights but within it's own distinctive area. Within walking distance of many of the best attractions and close to the U and S Bahn trains. There are enough places to eat or get a drink within 2 blocks of the hotel that you'll never have to worry about your next meal. I could go on and on but I'll just tell you to stay here when you visit Berlin. There's no doubt this is where we'll stay again if/when we ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Should Be A PARK HYATT!!”
Reviews.Author: ENK1973
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Grand Hyatt Berlin was actually a highlight of my Eastern European vacation. Hotels service, cleanliness, guest room, gym\pool facilities and location were absolutely perfect. (Stay June 16-18) Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Boring but Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Pippsyo
Reviews.Content: This hotel purrs like a Mercedes. It's a silky smooth and comfortable machine that is wonderfully comfortable and only lacks something truly distinctive to set it apart from all the other contemporary hotels in redevelopments around the world. Got a great deal on the Hyatt website and booked into a king bedded Grand room. Bathroom with its wood-panelled sliding doors was great, lovely walk-in shower on great stone floor. Everything you need as ever. Flat-panel TV boasted the heaviest remote control I've ever handled. Lighting was great, bed was very comfortable. Sound proofing was perfect. Genuinely luxurious. The only thing is that it could have been anywhere really. My feeling is that it is just a bit too bland with its high empty ceilings in the common areas which were filled in with anonymous background music. The blandness doesn't matter too much and to be fair it does echo the general numbing blandness of the entire Potsdamer Platz redevelopment of which the hotel is a part. And at least they try with big red walls and friendly staff who just manage to retain the sense of personal service despite the corporate sense of the place. But this really is a minor gripe - the place is fantastically comfortable and a great stay. We didn't eat in the restaurants and nor did we try the fitness centre but it was a very-well appointed hotel in terms of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: yrtx4e
Reviews.Content: The Berlin Grand Hyatt lives up to the GrandHyatt name. Location: very central for business and lesiuire traveller, around the corner there are rows of decent restaurants. The Concierge is excellent in recommending good restraurants. Dont' hesitate to ask. 5 mins to Posdamer Platz station. Mall, cinema and even Casino is around the cornr. Rooms: clean, sleek, grand. B&O flat screen TV & sound system. not extremely spacious for our Grand Twin room. The bathroom is spacious with tub and a rainshower cubical. Bathroom amenties are from Aveda. But the housekeeping staff was very mingy, not putting new or additional shower gel and moisturizer, she just screwed the cap back and put them there. Very disappointing. The room offers a good variety of tea and coffee making facilities. Internet is NOT WiFi. 18 Euro per day. Didn't use the business center, so no idea about the efficiency. Breakfast at Vox, selection is impressive. THe service is immaculate. The doormen are very courteous, cheerful, they truly extend that welcome everyday, not just aiming for tips. All in all , it's a great choice for Berlin, We have got a reasonable rate of E295 for the room w breakfast. I consider it pretty good. We kept one of our bags with Grand Hyatt after checking out on our 4-day trip to Prague. The Bell staff are very acommodating, the doorman saw us return, without a word, he rushed to get our bag out. impressive.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Germany”
Reviews.Author: epicentre
Reviews.Content: This is my preferred hotel for trips to Berlin and probably the best hotel in Germany. I love the minimalist, but functional clear design. The rooms are of modern design, but without the awkward feel of design hotels. They have managed to mix clear design with a cozy feeling so you just don't want to leave your room. The Vox restaurant is awesome, service in all areas of the hotel always top of the mark.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Basha59
Reviews.Content: What an avant-garde hotel located right in the centre of Berlin - the room was large (I had a king size bed) with all the amenities one would expect from a hotel of this nature, including fresh apples every day. The bathroom was to die for - I wanted to take that home but it would not fit in my suitcase! Service in the hotel was exceptional from the door men, to the restaurant staff to the girls behind the front desk. Breakfast in the restaurant was excellent with freshly made eggs - any style. Plus all the items available looked fresh and delicious. One minor complaint - it would have been great to have an iron available or in the room. Location was super - just around the corner from the Potsdamer Platz, the Sony Centre and many shops. Further down were the Brandenburg Gate, The Holocaust Memorial and so much more. All in all, I loved this hotel and Berlin - Ich Bin Ein Berliner!

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: Frankie-the-Hun
Reviews.Content: Would you expect a room in a hotel like this to have a connecting door to your neighbor? I didn't. So it was quite a surprise for me to hear him trade creche figurines over the phone late at night. Even more of a surprise was to hear from the night manager that I was the first person ever to complain... To cut it short: I had the chance to move to another room after pushing for it. As long as you make sure your room isn't connected to others it's a decent hotel in a convenient location for tourism and doing business with the government. Service in the Vox restaurant is good.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mhs24
Reviews.Content: I spent four days, three nights at the Grand Hyatt Berlin for a holiday weekend. It is wonderful! The staff--from the doorman, to front desk clerk, to the concierge, to the housekeepers--are courteous and friendly. The lobby Christmas decorations were tasteful and gorgeous. And the rooms were well appointed. I particularly liked the zoomy bathroom. I am a very light sleeper. The interior/courtyard room was perfect. I never heard street noise or another guest. The Potsdamer Platz location is outstanding. I heartily recommend this property and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Among the top 5 hotels I have stayed”
Reviews.Author: onBusiness015
Reviews.Content: Service: top Location: top, on Potdamer Platz walking distance to many places Room are nice and spacious. The best is the service. The staff is so attentive, I have ahrdly seen something similar. The bar features live music and is stylish, nice to relax after a long day. Also the spa area on the top of buidling is nice. What a place!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed77Bahrain
Reviews.Content: we are family of four took two bedrooms connected for six days. Paid in advance for better price. We enjoyed the hotel and the area very much. Sony building next to it which was very enjoyable to the teens. I too ejoyed the Beer garden at the Soney Centre. Have used the Hyatt restruant several times which is very good. We prefer the one next to the reseption due to food and informal comparing to the large one indoors/outdoors. Can not remember the name.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JESVancouver_B_C_
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable service from the moment you walk in the door. Not enough superlatives to describe the efficiency and friendliness, even down to the maids. Great location in Potzdammer Platz and lots of nearby restaurants and entertainment. The room was wonderful from the bed to the incredible shower/bath. Worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Impression of two wolrd travellers (not on bussiness)”
Reviews.Author: TheBonbonies
Reviews.Content: Could not say enough good things about this hotel. It exceeds 4* expectation. It is quite modern hotel, with modern furniture and decorations. Staff is quite helpful and friendly. We were surprised to arrive in our room and find a bottle of Champagne, lovely truffles and a special note to us. A really nice touch. The breakfast buffet at the VOXX restaurant is great. They offer a variety of fishes, cheeses, and charcuterie. Lovely breads, fruits, juices, etc. I would only say, if you are travelling for leasure, don't be surprised to see many business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: okyalos
Reviews.Content: I was shocked by the Hyatt berlin. Although i am not a five star naive client, i was astonished by this hotel .Even the clerkboys, were some beautiful women. The service is magnificent, you could see everywhere polite and smiling staff, and by far the most beautiful women i have seen working in any given hotel. The room itself cannot really be described by english language.Any attempt will really be unfair for the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience...”
Reviews.Author: Brabazon
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel with great staff. Very professional and courteous. In short, the kind of hotel experience you expect but don't often get. No complaints whatsoever...

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Stay on Club Floor”
Reviews.Author: spectra21
Reviews.Content: This was the most luxurious hotel I've ever stayed at. We stayed on the club floor, and you can see from the pictures--it is very sleek and modern. The bed was very slightly hard, but provided a comfortable night's sleep. It was the most comfortable bed I've slept in Europe so far. The bathroom was just the coolest. The bathtub and shower were enclosed by a glass door. There was also a TV monitor in the bathroom that was connected from the TV in the main area. Service was excellent during the stay. Housekeeping was prompt and cleaned the room while I was in the gym for an hour in the morning. The staff serving the club floor private lounge were all very kind and provided outstanding, friendly service. Besides breakfast, they served cakes and snacks during the day, and some appetizers/wine in the evening. Sebastian, the evening concierge in the main lobby, was also excellent and provided great dining recommendations each night we were there. The rooftop hotel gym and pool were great facilities and offered beautiful views of the city. This is a great area, convenient to all tourist attractions and the S and U-bahn. It is right near a shopping mall, casino, and near plenty of restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still My Global Favourite”
Reviews.Author: wadeonplanetearth
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times since 2004 and in travelling the globe have found the service and expectation consistantly met every time. This stay was a Hyatt reward on the club floor but have paid full pricing on all my previous visits, the big attaction for tired business travellers would have to be the outstanding fitout of all the rooms and the soundproofing. You will get a good sleep here.... We used the clubroom for breakfast the staff were friendly although breakfast at the hotel restaurant Vox on the ground floor is the way to go for choice that can't be beaten although it is fully priced accordingly. Walking Berlin is great but lunch in the hotel restaurant cafe was was a great experience and reasonably priced. I had the hotel do laundry on Saturday afternoon for my night on the town and they turned around casual clothes and business shirts etc in under 3 hours with better than my mothers effort on the ironing. We both found the staff friendly and not at all snobby for this standard of accomodation. If you are a design and interiors buff then you won't go past this hotel - Make sure you take the private lift up to the day spa and pool on the top floor the view ver Berlin is great. On pricing the food and extras are mid range compared to other European capitals with only breakfast seeking top euro figure.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Muntz73
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, this hotel is absolutely wonderful. It is worthy of 5*. The modern atmosphere is beautiful. The rooms are done very well. The lobby has great art. Nothing has gone un-noticed with this property. The service is perfect. I received a massage at the spa which was a beautiful spa. All of the facilities were just amazing. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “As good as all the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: patnlcc
Reviews.Content: We have used and enjoyed the Hyatt Club floor arrangement before, and were not disappointed in Berlin, which is a magnificent city and so worth a visit. The Club level rooms are very comfortable, spacious and quiet and have gorgeous bathrooms. The Club lounge set-up is excellent, continental breakfast is available - very generous, altho no hot food - cakes/snacks from 3pm to 5pm (most people are out sightseeing) and a 'buffet' from 6pm until 8pm. Not the biggest buffet in the world, but more than enough for us. Free wine/beer/sparkling wine during these two hours also, and very generous amounts. The club lounge was a home from home and we relaxed there in the evenings over a couple of glasses of wine, before having an evening stroll and then turning in after a day's sightseeing. Berlin is a must-see city and don't forget Potsdam - a history buff's treat - and the Hyatt is the place to stay. We loved it. Buy the 2 or 3 day transport pass for 18 or 22 euros, you can hop on and off U-bahns, S-bahns and buses all day.

Reviews.Title: “WoW, what a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carbiker
Reviews.Content: I went on a big European family vacation this summer with the whole clan (four adults, three kids, four countries, 3 weeks), and one of the highlights was the Grand Hyatt in Berlin; by far the best hotel in a trip filled with wonderful stays. I apologize for the length of this review in advance, but I just can't say enough about this amazing place. What a gorgeous hotel, and just what you imagine Berlin might be: stark, modern, clean, and efficient (such a nice change from the "old world" feel of all the hotels in Rome, Paris and London). I don't know a lot about Berlin (it was my first visit), but this hotel is really in a great area to explore. There are numerous museums, a big shopping mall, a huge live theater (Blue Man Group had just opened), an IMAX theater (and film museum), all within blocks of this hotel (and the kids loved the Mc Donald's next door!). Oh, and and the Starbuck's right across the street was nice too. We had three rooms in total: my folks had a one-bedroom corner suite on the third floor and we had two separate (two queen bed) rooms on the concierge floor (I think the 23rd floor). The suite was a real gem, with a nice view out of the corner living room that overlooked the front entrance of the hotel. The mini bar was COMPLIMENTARY (the kids loved this, as they had been forbidden to enter the mini bars in any of our previous hotels!), and there was even a stocked bar with liquor as well as a complimentary bottle of wine (my dad cracked this open right away) and a beautiful bowl of fresh fruit and cheese. There was also a DVD player with a BOSE surround sound system in the living room (There was large selection of DVD's to choose from in the concierge club room as well, with lot's of family friendly entertainment). The floor to ceiling doors opened to a bedroom with a king bed. The decor was modern (almost "cubist") and predominantly black (of course!), but suprisingly the room was not "dark". Our rooms on the upper floors were just as nice for "regular" rooms. I loved the utterly modern feel of this hotel. walking down the hallways felt like you were in a futuristic sci-fi movie or on a spaceship. Even the "do not disturb" signs on each door is a push button light! The greatest thing about all of the rooms however: the bathrooms. Simply magnificent. I especially liked the "overflow" bathtubs... they are enclosed behind glass in a huge travertine shower the size of half the room. There is a "notch" cut out of the side of the tub so that you can fill the tub all the way to the brim, and let the water flow over the edge when you get in. To get to soak all the way to the chin is such complete luxury. There is also a flat screen TV and sound system to enjoy while soaking in the tub! I really want to copy that bathroom in my house. As great as the hotel was, the real star of this property are the people. The staff was magnificent, with perfect english (with just the slightest accent, of course!), and a true dedication to service. No request was ignored or delayed, no employee encountered without a smile and warm "hello." A lovely young woman escorted us personally to our rooms and explained all the features and amenities. And did I mention everyone is gorgeous!? There must be a rule that you can't be over 30 to work in this hotel, they all looked like models. The men were even better looking than the women! *sigh* I love Germany. The concierge room was a real treat. Each day it is the offical "breakfast" room (included in the room rate). With a lovely continental cold breakfast buffet set up. The coffee is fantastic, with a lovely froth on top from the machine. The wait staff is attentive and always close by. The selection of breads, pastries, & cereals was good and there was also fresh fruit and always a fish and meat selection as well. Oh, and an unexpected bonus for Europe: the room is completely NON-SMOKING for the breakfast service! A lovely way to start the day. In the afternoon, the selection turned to tasty & savory cold appetizers and pastries. Also Coffee, tea and all kinds of soft drinks and juices to try (the banana nectar is great!). And a staff always eager to serve. Small touches abounded: when we arrived in the concierge "club room" the first morning for breakfast, we started to push two tables together because our party was large and all the tables were set for four. Well, the staff politely informed us that they would be happy to do it for us, and also that they would have it set up for us in advance each morning of our stay... and so it was the next morning all set up when we walked in. When we left on the final day (sadly) we had rented a large van for the drive to Munich. When we returned to the hotel and loaded up, checked out and finally got ready to go... one of the doormen came out and presented each of us with a large bottle of water to have for our long trip! I was amazed at how considerate this was. One more bonus I forgot to mention... my Dad travels a lot for business, and our entire stay was free with his Hyatt Gold Passport points! The worst thing about our stay is that it was too short... only two nights. The city of Berlin is huge and there is so much to see. I can't wait to go back! I can only hope I'm fortunate enough to stay at the Grand Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: dadinha
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, great design and great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CVCVws
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel close to everything. Make sure and take the hop on and off bus to see all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending three nights at this hotel on business. I've stayed at a lot of hotels all over the world and this is definitely up there with the best. The service is quite likely the best (and most subtle) I've ever experienced. In fact, everything about the hotel is non-intrusive. The rooms with glorious bathrooms, Aveda amenities, a swimming pool that was all mine every morning I used it, a plentiful buffet breakfast surpassed only by Hotel Arts in Barcelona, a Herald Tribune AND USA Today readily available...In short, a terrific hotel in a fabulous location. If I have any complaints at all it would have to be the coffee. It's just not that good. But that's not a problem as there's a Starbucks across the street...
